name: Aberrant Horror
description: Aberrant Horrors are the result of a humanoid becoming an aberration. Able to break free from the physical restrictions imposed upon them by the Material Plane, they shift the components of their form at a whim. This makes Aberrant Horrors terrifying to behold, especially in battle. Many adversaries have been caught off-guard when a seemingly defenceless opponent grew rows of gruesome spines before their eyes.

prereq.roleplay: You must have had an encounter with an Aberration, magical anomaly, or some other plausible reason to have become an Aberrant Horror. Discuss with your GM how you can achieve this in your backstory or in-game.

milestones: Defeating a powerful Aberration and absorbing its power
Undergoing a dangerous and costly experiment
Surviving a magical mishap
Acquiring the strength to give birth to a more powerful version of yourself, which then consumes your old self
Fulfilling an eldritch prophecy written in the stars

boons.name: Aberrant Adaptations
boons.description: Your body can twist and reshape itself as you will it, changing body parts into dangerous weapons or useful tools, and regenerating after damage. You gain the following adaptations:

subFeatures.name: Chitinous Shell
subFeatures.description: As a bonus action while you are not wearing heavy armor, you can develop a hard, crustacean-like shell.  When you do so, you gain a +2 bonus to your Armor Class, but your speed is reduced by 10 feet. This adaptation lasts for 1 minute or until you are knocked unconscious, or until you use a bonus action to end it.

subFeatures.name: Eldritch Limbs
subFeatures.description: You can transform one or both of your arms into a weapon of thick muscle, sharp claws, or hardened bone. When you take the Attack action, you can transform one of your arms into a weapon and make an attack with it.  This attack is considered an unarmed strike, and uses your Strength modifier for its attack and damage rolls.  It deals 1d8 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (your choice) on a hit.

boons.name: Aberrant Form
boons.description:
Your Constitution score increases by 2 and your Strength score increases by 1. An ability score cannot be increased beyond 16 this way.

You become an Aberration in addition to any other creature types you are.

flaw.name: Unstable Mutations
flaw.description:
Your body becomes malleable and struggles to maintain any one physical shape. Upon completing a long rest, you must roll 1d100 on the Unstable Form table and apply the effects of the result, determined by your transformation level. These effects last until you complete another long rest. If you roll the same result on the table more than once in a row, roll again until a new result is rolled.
d100 Effect
Level 1 Level 2 Level 3 Level 4
1 - 5 1 - 8 1 - 9 1 - 11 Your body starts to become formless.  You have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.
6 - 10 9 - 16 10 - 18 12 - 22 You start to become rigid and brittle, making resting less effective. When you consume a hit dice, you do not add your Constitution modifier to the result.
11 - 15 17 - 24 19 - 27 23 - 33 Your body starts sweating a viscous substance that hardens quickly. You cannot doff armour or change clothes. Dropping, stowing, or interacting with an object requires an action.
16 - 24 25 - 32 28 - 36 34 - 43 You immediately throw up a thick, black ichor and begin feeling nauseous. You do not benefit from the effects of any food, drink, or potions consumed.
25 - 32 33 - 40 37 - 45 44 - 52 You are only able to form one-word sentences in a guttural voice you do not recognise. You can still cast spells with verbal components.
33 - 40 35 - 48 46 - 54 53 - 61 Your legs become unresponsive and difficult to move. Your walking speed decreases by 10 feet.
41 - 48 42 - 56 55 - 63 62 - 70 Your body begins fighting against any shape you take.  You cannot take reactions.
49 - 56 57 - 64 64 - 72 71 - 77 Your arms periodically have a will of their own, causing your reaction speed to slow while you regain control of them. You have disadvantage on Dexterity ability checks to determine initiative order.
57 - 64 65 - 72 73 - 80 78 - 84 Your skin quivers and shifts, while your appearance constantly changes. Every 30 seconds a defining feature of appearance changes, such as hair colour, facial features, or body proportions.
65 - 81 73 - 83 81 - 89 85 - 91 Nothing happens.
82 - 91 84 - 92 90 - 95 92 - 96 You become immune to being grappled or restrained.
92 - 100 93 - 100 96 - 100 97 - 100 If you would gain hit points from a spell or ability other than your own, you gain that many hit points plus your Constitution modifier instead.

boons.name: Efficient Killer
boons.description: When you make an attack using your Eldritch Limbs adaptation, the attack gains one of the following additional effects depending on the type of damage you chose:

subFeatures.name: Bludgeoning
subFeatures.description: The attack deals an additional 1d8 bludgeoning damage.  Additionally, once per turn, when you hit a creature with this attack you can make an additional attack against another creature within 5 feet of them as part of the same action.

subFeatures.name: Piercing
subFeatures.description: The attack gains a short range of 30 feet and a long range of 120 feet.

subFeatures.name: Slashing
subFeatures.description: The attack deals an additional 1d8 slashing damage, and the target must succeed at a Constitution saving throw. Upon a failed save, the target begins bleeding (1d8) for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself upon a success.

boons.name: Otherworldly Tendrils
boons.description:
You can use a bonus action to grow a long, tendril-like appendage out of your body. The tendril is a natural weapon you can use to make unarmed strikes, and it has a reach of 10 feet. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can make an additional attack with the tendril as a bonus action. The tendril lasts until you become unconscious, or until you use a bonus action to retract it.

Additionally, when you hit a creature with the tendril, you can cause one of the following effects instead of dealing damage:

subFeatures.name: Constrict
subFeatures.description: The tendril wraps tightly around the target. If the target is no larger than one size larger than you, it is grappled. Until the grapple is ended, the tendril cannot be used against other targets.

subFeatures.name: Hypnotic Trance
subFeatures.description: The tendril flashes a myriad of coloured bioluminescent lights, attempting to disorient the target. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, all attacks against the target are made at advantage until the start of the target's next turn.

subFeatures.name: Toxic Spray
subFeatures.description: A lamprey-like mouth opens at the end of the tendril and sprays a noxious toxin. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they become poisoned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself upon a success.

boons.name: Situational Evolution
boons.description: You gain the following adaptations:

subFeatures.name: Aquatic Physiology
subFeatures.description: As a bonus action, you grow fins and gills.  You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, and you can breathe underwater. This adaptation lasts until you are knocked unconscious, or until you use a bonus action to end it.

subFeatures.name: Scopulae
subFeatures.description: As a bonus action, you grow thin hairs on your extremeties.  Your gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.  You can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving one hand free. This adaptation lasts until you are knocked unconscious, or until you use a bonus action to end it.

subFeatures.name: Regenerative Tissue
subFeatures.description: As a bonus action, you grow a layer of rapidly regenerating flesh. At the beginning of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to your Constitution modifier if you have no more than half your hit points left. If you take any amount of acid or fire damage, this adaptation doesn't function on your next turn. This adaptation lasts for 1 minute or until you are knocked unconscious, or until you use a bonus action to end it.

flaw.name: Hideous Appearance
flaw.description:
Your appearance has grotesquely transformed. You may be a hulking mass of flesh, adorned with countless eyes, or a bone-and-tusk-covered natural weapon. Regardless of your true form, you're horrific to behold. You can suspend this form and manifest the appearance of the humanoid you once were, but this is taxing and requires concentration. This form is not permanent, and moments of stress are likely to reveal your true nature. Your true form is revealed in the following situations:
  • Concentrating on a spell.
  • Being knocked unconscious.
  • Entering hallowed ground.
  • Choosing to reveal yourself.
In events of extreme emotional or physical stress, a GM may call for a Constitution saving throw with a DC of their choosing to see if you maintain your humanoid form.

boons.name: Mutated Wings
boons.description: You gain the following adaptation:

subFeatures.name: Wings
subFeatures.description: As a bonus action, you grow large, twisted wings of mutated flesh. You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.  This adaptation lasts until you are knocked unconscious, or until you use a bonus action to end it.

boons.name: Additional Tendrils
boons.description:
You grow two tendrils instead of one. When you use your bonus action to attack with your tendril, you may instead make one attack with each of your tendrils.

For each additional level you gain in this transformation, you grow an additional tendril.

boons.name: Enhanced Hypertrohpy
boons.description: Your unarmed strikes, including those made with your natural weapons, deal d10s of damage, instead of their normal damage dice.

boons.name: Shifting Form
boons.description:
Your body has begun to lose its cohesion, softening and shifting like thick jelly. Any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

Additionally, whenever you make an attack using your Eldritch Limbs, you deal an additional 1d6 acid damage.

Finally, you gain resistance to acid damage.

flaw.name: Unstable Existence
flaw.description: The nature of magic is beginning to unravel your material form. Whenever you roll a natural 1, 2, or 3 on a saving throw against a spell or magical ability, you reveal your Hideous Appearance.

boons.name: Savage Predator
boons.description: Beginning at 4th level, whenever you hit a creature with a critical hit, you deal an additional 6d6 damage. In addition, each creature of your choice that is within 30 feet of you must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

boons.name: Extremophilic Conditioning
boons.description: You gain the following adaptation:

subFeatures.name: Metamorphosis
subFeatures.description:
As an action, you rapidly change your body's biophysical and chemical composition in reaction to your environment. Choose one of the following options:
  • You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
  • You gain resistance to acid, fire, and lightning damage.
  • You are resistant to cold, poison, and thunder damage.
This adaptation lasts until you use it again.

boons.name: Master of the Deep
boons.description:
As an action, you can rapidly grow and launch hundreds of tiny tendrils from your body. Each creature of your choice within 15 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they suffer one of the following effects of your choice for 1 minute. You can choose different effect options for each creature:
  • The target is poisoned.
  • The target's speed becomes 0.
  • Attacks against the target are made at advantage.

Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

boons.name: Amorphous Form
boons.description:
Your body has continued to dissolve into a corrosive slurry of flesh and bone similar to an ooze. You are able to move through gaps as narrow as 1 inch wide, and you can't be grappled, restrained, or knocked prone.

In addition, whenever you take 10 or more points of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, you may choose to continue splitting along the wound, separating into two distinct parts that reform into versions of yourself that are one size category smaller than the original. As you split you may choose how your armor and other equipment is split between the two. The two share hit points, spell slots, and other resources.

While split, on your turn you may move with each form and you may also take one action with each form. You may only take one bonus action and one reaction per turn, although you may choose which segment you want to act when you do so.

You may reform into a single body as an action while your segments are within 5 feet of each oher, becoming your normal size again. If you finish a long rest while split, one of the segments dissolves into goo and you become your normal size again.

flaw.name: Entropic Abomination
flaw.description: The very essence of magic aggravates the unstable nature of your aberrant body. Whenever you fail a saving throw to a spell or magical ability, roll on the Unstable Mutation table.

name: Draconian
description: Unlike becoming a half-dragon or draconic sorcerer, this transformation is deeply unnatural and rarely willing.  In the beginning, victims appear similarly to how they did before, with only slight signs of the corruption. In the early stages it becomes clearly visible, but their body type remains generally the same. Horns or similar features might appear at this stage. In its late stage they begin to bear resemblance closer to that of a dragonborn or a half-dragon, and they also lose any features atypical to them, like ears or hair. In its final stage, their body has morphed beyond recognition. Their appearance is more akin to that of a true dragon forcibly mangled into a humanoid shape. People who knew you before couldn't possibly recognize you now.

prereq.roleplay: You must have encountered a locus of draconic magic.  Most commonly, this transformation is a result of finding a cursed object within a dragon's hoard, but other methods could include being directly cursed by a powerful dragon, or willingly undergoing this transformation with the help of a draconic sponsor.

milestones: Absorbing the power of a powerful dragon by eating its heart
Being cursed or blessed by a draconic deity or greatwyrm
Acquiring a vast hoard
Harnessing draconic magic with the use of rituals or alchemical concoctions

boons.name: Draconic Lineage
boons.description:
Your curse manifested from a specific breed of dragon: your Draconic Lineage. Your body is infused with powerful draconic magic. You must choose a type of dragon below, which affects other features of this transformation.
DragonDamage TypeShapeSaving Throw
LunarColdConeConstitution
SolarRadiantConeConstitution
VoidRadiantConeDexterity
BlackAcidLineDexterity
BlueLightningLineDexterity
GreenPoisonConeConstitution
RedFireConeDexterity
WhiteColdConeConstitution
AmethystForceConeStrength
CrystalRadiantConeDexterity
EmeraldPsychicConeIntelligence
MoonstoneRadiantLineDexterity
ObsidianFireConeDexterity
RubyFireConeDexterity
SapphireThunderConeConstitution
TopazNecroticConeConstitution
BrassFireLineDexterity
BronzeLightningLineDexterity
CopperAcidLineDexterity
GoldFireConeDexterity
PlatinumRadiantConeDexterity
SilverColdConeConstitution
SteelPoisonConeConstitution
TungstenThunderConeConstitution
DeepPsychicConeWisdom
ShadowNecroticConeConstitution

subFeatures.name: Breath Weapon
subFeatures.description:
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 15-foot cone or 30-foot line (determined by your Draconic Legacy above). Each creature in that area must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your Draconic Legacy. On a failed save, the creature takes damage equal to a number of d10s equal to your proficiency bonus of your Draconic Legacy type. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.

You can use your breath weapon a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subFeatures.name: Infusion
subFeatures.description: Your attacks deal an additional 1d4 damage of your Draconic Legacy type. You gain resistance to the same damage type. If at any point you acquire resistance to the same type from a different source, instead reduce the damage taken by your proficiency bonus after accounting for resistance.

traits.name: Lunar Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is cold.

traits.name: Solar Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is radiant.

traits.name: Void Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is radiant.

traits.name: Black Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is acid.

traits.name: Blue Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is lightning.

traits.name: Green Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is poison.

traits.name: Red Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is fire.

traits.name: White Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is cold.

traits.name: Amethyst Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is force.

traits.name: Diamond Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is radiant.

traits.name: Emerald Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is psychic.

traits.name: Moonstone Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is radiant.

traits.name: Obsidian Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is fire.

traits.name: Ruby Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is fire.

traits.name: Sapphire Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is thunder.

traits.name: Topaz Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is necrotic.

traits.name: Brass Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is fire.

traits.name: Bronze Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is lightning.

traits.name: Copper Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is acid.

traits.name: Gold Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is fire.

traits.name: Platinum Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is radiant.

traits.name: Silver Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is cold.

traits.name: Steel Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is poison.

traits.name: Tungsten Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is thunder.

traits.name: Shadow Dragon Legacy
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is necrotic.

boons.name: Draconic Form
boons.description:
Your Constitution score increases by 2 and your Strength score increases by 1. An ability score cannot be increased beyond 16 this way.

You become a Dragon in addition to any other creature types you are.

flaw.name: Object of Obsession
flaw.description: You have an obsession with a specific object or course of action.  Work with the DM to determine what this obsession is.  If you finish a long rest without fulfilling your desire since your last long rest, you gain a level of exhaustion. Exhaustion gained in this way cannot exceed 5 levels.

boons.name: Loyal Servants
boons.description: During a short rest you may magically create a number of kobolds equal to your proficiency bonus to serve you. They use the Kobold Scalepriest stat block, however they gain temporary hit points equal to your level. They follow all of your commands to the best of their ability. You can replace kobolds during a short rest but you can never have more than your proficiency bonus.

boons.name: Draconic Fury
boons.description:
You can use a bonus action to manifest a draconic natural weapon out of your body that you are proficient with and make an attack with it. The effects of the attack are determined by which natural weapon is used.

You can use your natural weapons a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

subFeatures.name: Claws
subFeatures.description: Make two melee attacks against creatures within 5 feet of you.  On a hit, each attack deals magical slashing damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier.

subFeatures.name: Horns
subFeatures.description: You move up to twice your speed in a straight line.  You can move through the spaces of other creatures, and each creature you come into contact with must make a Strength saving throw, or they take magical bludgeoning damage equal 1d8 + your Strength modifier and are forcefully moved with you until you finish your charge, taking no damage, not being moved with you, and being knocked prone on a successful save.

subFeatures.name: Tail
subFeatures.description: Make a melee weapon attack against a creature within 15 feet of you.  On a hit, the target takes magical bludgeoning damage equal to 2d8 + your Strength modifier and is knocked prone.

subFeatures.name: Wings
subFeatures.description: All creatures within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone and take magical bludgeoning damage equal to 2d8 + your Strength modifier. You can then move up to half your speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

boons.name: Dragon Rot
boons.description:
You learn to weave a simple draconic disease. When you hit a creature with an attack, you can force them to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they take 2d4 damage of your Draconic Legacy type.

At the end of each of the creature's turns, they must repeat the saving throw. On a failed save, they take the damage once again, ending the effect on a success. You may only have one creature affected by Dragon Rot at a time.

flaw.name: Hideous Appearance
flaw.description:
Your appearance has grotesquely transformed. You have horns, scales, and perhaps the beginnings of a tail and wings ripping through your flesh. Regardless of your true form, you're horrific to behold. You can suspend this form and manifest the appearance of the humanoid you once were, but this is taxing and requires concentration. This form is not permanent, and moments of stress are likely to reveal your true nature. Your true form is revealed in the following situations:
  • Concentrating on a spell.
  • Being knocked unconscious.
  • Entering hallowed ground.
  • Choosing to reveal yourself.
In events of extreme emotional or physical stress, a GM may call for a Constitution saving throw with a DC of their choosing to see if you maintain your humanoid form.

boons.name: Draconic Wings
boons.description: You grow large, scaled wings like those of your source dragon.  You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

boons.name: Frightful Presence
boons.description: At the beginning of your turn, you may force each creature of your choice within 60 feet of you that is aware of you to make a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened by you until the start of your next turn. Once a creature succeeds on this saving throw it becomes immune to your Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

boons.name: Elemental Mastery
boons.description: As your draconic power grows so does your mastery over the elements. When you deal damage of your Draconic Legacy type, it cannot be reduced by any means. Additionally, you gain immunity to the same damage type.

traits.name: Lunar Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is cold.

traits.name: Solar Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is radiant.

traits.name: Void Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is radiant.

traits.name: Black Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is acid.

traits.name: Blue Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is lightning.

traits.name: Green Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is poison.

traits.name: Red Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is fire.

traits.name: White Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is cold.

traits.name: Amethyst Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is force.

traits.name: Diamond Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is radiant.

traits.name: Emerald Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is psychic.

traits.name: Moonstone Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is radiant.

traits.name: Obsidian Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is fire.

traits.name: Ruby Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is fire.

traits.name: Sapphire Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is thunder.

traits.name: Topaz Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is necrotic.

traits.name: Brass Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is fire.

traits.name: Bronze Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is lightning.

traits.name: Copper Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is acid.

traits.name: Gold Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is fire.

traits.name: Platinum Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is radiant.

traits.name: Silver Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is cold.

traits.name: Steel Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is poison.

traits.name: Tungsten Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is thunder.

traits.name: Shadow Elemental Mastery
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is necrotic.

flaw.name: Draconic Ego
flaw.description: Alongside the power of true dragons, you also obtain their ego. Once per turn when you miss an attack, fail a saving throw, or fail an ability check by 5 or more, you take 2d4 psychic damage. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.

boons.name: Improved Breath Weapon
boons.description: Your breath weapon increases in size to a 30-foot cone or 60-foot line, and its damage increases to double the number of d10s.

boons.name: Hardened Scales
boons.description: The scales covering your body grow incredibly strong, granting you resistance to bludgeoning, slashing and piercing damage.

boons.name: True Infusion
boons.description: Your attacks now deal an additional 2d8 damage of your Draconic Legacy type.  In addition, when you cast a spell that deals the same damage type, it is treated as though you had cast it with a spell slot one level higher, and it cannot be counterspelled.

flaw.name: Insatiable Pride
flaw.description: You finally see it, how could you be so blind? All of those pests only seek to backstab you, they wish to steal your riches, to overthrow you. No. You won't let them. Their tricks and illusion won't fool you anymore. You never count as a willing creature for the purpose of spells and features, and cannot willingly fail saving throws.

name: Fey
description: The fey are changeable beings of great power and even greater danger. No two fey are quite alike, but their tie to the natural world is universal. Mortals cannot comprehend the level of true freedom the faerie people feel. To know such freedom is to change entirely.

prereq.roleplay: You must have sworn fealty to one of the fey courts, been raised in the realms as a changeling, or have some other plausible reason to have become a fey. Discuss with your GM how you can achieve this in the game.

milestones: Striking a bargain with a greater fey
Performing a great deed in the name of one of the faerie queens
Establishing a new faerie ring or bridge to the fey realms
Defeating a powerful agent from your rival court
Earning a domain or title in the realm of faerie

boons.name: Fey Form
boons.description:
Your Charisma score increases by 2 and your Dexterity score increases by 1. An ability score cannot be increased beyond 16 this way. You become a Fey in addition to any other creature types you are.

When you gain this ability, you must also choose which Fey court fuels your transformation.

traits.description: The summer court embodies the bounty and warmth of the growing season. The fey of summer tend towards joviality, fickleness, and vanity. Creatures of summer often hide their cruel intentions behind beautiful facades.

The winter court embodies the stillness and darkness of the coldest season. The fey of winter tend to be serious, cruel, and reflective. Creatures of winter are often terrifying to behold but very direct about their intentions.

boons.name: Twilight Step
boons.description:
As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Your twilight step also gains an additional feature depending on which court you are a part of.

You can use the Twilight Step feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Searing Step
traits.description: Immediately after using your Twilight Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 damage).

traits.name: Freezing Step
traits.description: Immediately after using your Twilight Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes cold damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 damage).

flaw.name: Planar Binding
flaw.description:
Your body and soul are bound to one of the faerie realms. You have disadvantage on death saving throws as the plane attempts to pull you back to it. If you would be killed, your soul is dragged back to a plane of existence of the GM's choice.

If you are in the faerie realm responsible for your transformation, this flaw has no effect.

boons.name: Two-Faced
boons.description:
You can choose to transform your face into a vision of enchanting loveliness or horrifying ugliness. Any non-Fey creature within 30 feet of you when you transform your face must make a Wisdom saving throw or be affected for 1 minute.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Face of Beauty
traits.description: Any creature that fails the saving throw becomes charmed. This effect ends early on a creature if you or an ally deal damage to it or take other harmful actions.

traits.name: Face of Horror
traits.description: Any creature that fails the saving throw becomes frightened of you. This effect ends early if a creature affected by this ability ends its turn out of your line of sight.

boons.name: Sprite Servant
boons.description: A fey sprite binds itself to your service. The sprite appears as a floating ball of light.

boons.name: Magic Tricks
boons.description:
Your transformation grants you innate power, which manifests as the ability to cast a small number of spells. You learn one Divination or Enchantment cantrip.

In addition, choose one 1st-level and one 2nd-level Divination or Enchantment spell. You can cast each of these spells once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast them in this way when you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

flaw.name: Queen's Command
flaw.description:
The fey court lends you its power, and in exchange you must pay regular tribute to maintain your freedom. Twice a year, on each solstice, you must deliver a treasure or other significant tribute to whichever fey queen you are a part of the court of. If you do not provide a tribute by the appointed day, your queen pulls you immediately to her faerie realm.

Once pulled in this way, you must remain in the faerie realm for 100 years, or until you strike a bargain with the queen to let you return to the mortal plane. Your GM will tell you what constitutes an appropriate tribute to the court. Some fey queens prefer magic items while others wish for long kept secrets, the capture of fey criminals, or humanoid servants.

boons.name: Made of Magic
boons.description:
Your transformation into a fey has changed the fundamental nature of your body. You gain resistance to damage from spells.

In addition, when you make a saving throw against a spell you can use a reaction to gain advantage on the roll. Once you use this reaction, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

boons.name: Courtly Graces
boons.description:
You gain proficiency in two skills determined by your court. If you are already proficient in one or both of these skills, then your proficiency bonus is doubled for ability checks using that skill.

Additionally, your fealty to a fey court offers you protection from certain emotions associated with the court.

traits.name: Gracious Host
traits.description: You gain proficiency in Performance and Persuasion, and you are immune to being charmed.

traits.name: Decieving Monster
traits.description: You gain proficiency in Deception and Intimidation, and you are immune to being frightened.

flaw.name: Bound by Words
flaw.description: The fey choose their words carefully for they are bound by them, and so too are you. When you give your word to a creature, the commitment becomes magically enforced, and you are bound by the letter of what you promise. If you fail to fulfill your part of the agreement, you lose the benefit of all of your fey transformation boons until you surrender an additional tithe to your queen, as described in your Queen's Command flaw.

boons.name: Greater Magic Tricks
boons.description:
Choose a Divination or Enchantment spell of 3rd, 4th, and 5th level. You can cast each of these spells once without expending a spell slot and regain the ability to cast them in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

Additionally, you can cast the 1st and 2nd level spells from the Magic Tricks Boon twice per short or long rest.

boons.name: Misdirection
boons.description: Light and magic bend strangely around you, making you difficult to hit. Attack rolls against you are made at disadvantage. If you are hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of your next turn. This trait only works while you are conscious.

boons.name: Twilight Glamour
boons.description: As an action, you can become magically invisible until you attack or cast a spell. Once your invisibility ends in this way, you cannot use this feature again for 1 minute.

flaw.name: Seasonally Affected
flaw.description:
Your connection to the fey courts has granted you tremendous power but also an esoteric fragility: you gain vulnerability to cold damage if you are in the summer court, or to fire damage if you are in the winter court.

In addition, whenever you take damage of that type, your maximum hit points are reduced by an equal amount. When your maximum hit points are reduced by this effect, they return to normal after you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Aversion to Cold
traits.description: You gain vulnerability to cold damage.

traits.name: Aversion to Heat
traits.description: You gain vulnerability to fire damage.

name: Fiend
description: A mortal can become a Fiend in a variety of ways. Some forfeit their souls and become one upon death. Others undertake excruciating rituals to transform into one. However, your character becomes a Fiend constitutes their contract. Communicating with your GM about creating deals with mortals in their story is a great way to roleplay your influence within the game world. As a Fiend, you should consider what your character's motivations are and which NPCs they can use to achieve their goals.

prereq.roleplay: You must have made a pact with a Fiend, undergone an infernal ritual, or have some other plausible reason to have become a Fiend. Discuss with your GM how you can achieve this in-game.

milestones: Defeating a greater rival Fiend and taking their place in the hierarchy
Ensnaring a particularly powerful or influential soul with a contract
Establishing a cult of worshipers who offer their strength to you
Establishing a portal between the material plane and the lower planes
Killing or corrupting a Seraph

boons.name: Gifts of Damnation
boons.description:
You have acquired the ability to bind your first mortal to your will. You can create a contract to bind their soul to you, feeding on its power. However, you will not gain the benefits of this gift until you have bound a mortal with a contract.

To bind a mortal's soul to you and grant them a Gift of Damnation, you must first create a contract for that gift. A contract requires magical ink and paper worth 50gp for each Transformation level you have acquired, and you must meet the prerequisites listed. In addition, you and the mortal must both sign the contract willingly, fully aware of the costs involved. Once signed, fiendish entities give the benefits of the gift to you, and the mortal receives the named benefit within 7 days. You do not have to provide this benefit yourself. For example, upon signing a contract for a Gift of Unfettered Glory, you will receive the benefits listed under the gift. The mortal who signs will receive glory and no in-game mechanical bonuses, provided by the dubious powers of the lower planes.

While you may have any number of contracts in your possession, you can only benefit from one at a time. Upon the completion of a long rest, you may swap the contract you are currently benefiting from for an alternate contract that you have bound a mortal to and signed.

On your turn, as an action, you can call upon fiendish energies to reveal to you the exact location of a creature that has signed one of your contracts, providing they are on the same plane of existence as you.

A contract you hold lasts for 7 years or until the mortal that signed it dies. At which point it bursts into flames and you cannot receive any benefits from it.

boons.name: Fiendish Form
boons.description: Your Charisma score increases by 2 and your Intelligence score increases by 1. An ability score cannot be increased beyond 16 this way. You become a Fiend in addition to any other creature types you are.

flaw.name: Planar Binding
flaw.description:
Your body and soul are bound to a fiendish plane of existence. You have disadvantage on death saving throws as the plane attempts to pull you back to it. If you would be killed, your soul is dragged back to a plane of existence of the GM's choice.

If you are on the fiendish plane responsible for your transformation, this flaw has no effect.

boons.name: Brand of the Chainer's Gaze
boons.description: As a bonus action on your turn, you can brand a creature within 60 feet of you with a fiery mark that diminishes their resolve. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, and on a failed save they are cursed. Whenever a creature cursed in this way makes a saving throw, they must roll 1d6 and subtract the result from their saving throw. A creature remains cursed this way for 1 minute. The brand disappears if the creature is knocked unconscious or enters hallowed ground. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

boons.name: Brand of the Deciever's Guile
boons.description:
As a bonus action on your turn, you can brand a creature within 60 feet of you with a fiery mark that exudes hellfire. The target must make a Charisma saving throw, and on a failed save they are cursed. Whenever you hit a creature cursed in this way with an attack, you deal an additional 1d6 fire damage.

A creature remains cursed for 1 minute. The brand disappears if the creature is knocked unconscious or enters hallowed ground. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

boons.name: Brand of the Slayer's Lash
boons.description:
As an action, a flaming whip appears in your hand and lashes out at a creature you can see within 10 feet of you. That creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d4 fire damage and is inflicted with a searing brand, and is considered cursed.

While cursed in this way, the creature is tied to you with a wreathing leash of flame and cannot use its movement to move more than 10 feet away from you. On your turn, you may use a bonus action to drag the creature up to 10 feet in any direction. You may also use your reaction to prevent any event that would take the creature out of range.

A creature remains cursed this way for 1 minute. The brand disappears if the creature is knocked unconscious or enters hallowed ground, or if the creature is more than 10 feet away from you at the end of your turn.

boons.name: Brand of the Tyrant's Hellfire
boons.description:
As a bonus action on your turn, you can brand a creature within 60 feet of you with a fiery mark that twists their senses and perspective. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw, and on a failed save they are cursed. Whenever a creature cursed in this way attempts to attack you, they must roll 1d6 and subtract the result from their attack roll.

A creature remains cursed this way for 1 minute. The brand disappears if the creature is knocked unconscious or enters hallowed ground. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

flaw.name: Hideous Appearance
flaw.description:
Your appearance has grotesquely transformed. Your skin becomes red and leathery, and vicious horns, teeth and nails erupt through the surface of your skin. You can suppress this form and present the appearance of the humanoid you once were, but this is taxing and requires concentration. Moments of stress are likely to reveal your true nature. In the following situations your true form is revealed:
  • Concentrating on a spell.
  • Being knocked unconscious.
  • Entering hallowed ground.
  • Choosing to reveal yourself.
In events of extreme emotional or physical stress, a GM may call for a Constitution saving throw with a DC of their choosing to see if you maintain your humanoid form.

Non-evil creatures that witness your true form become instantly hostile to you, unless the GM decides otherwise.

boons.name: Alluring Deceit
boons.description:
You gain mastery of deception and hollow promises. You gain proficiency in Deception and Persuasion. If you are already proficient in either of these skills, then your proficiency bonus is doubled for ability checks using that skill.

Magic that would determine if you are telling the truth always indicates you are being truthful, and you cannot be magically compelled to tell the truth.

boons.name: Infernal Resistance
boons.description: You gain an imposing fortitude, drawing on fiendish energy. If you would take magical damage, you can use your reaction and take half the amount of damage instead. You cannot use this feature against damage dealt by a silvered weapon.

boons.name: Infernal Lackey
boons.description: Your mastery of the infernal laws allows you to utilize the benefits of two Gifts of Damnation simultaneously. In addition, you may change gifts on a short rest instead of a long rest.

boons.name: Netherblade
boons.description:
You can use a bonus action to summon a dreaded Netherblade. The blade takes the form of a melee weapon that deals slashing damage of your choice. Attacks made with the blade deal fire damage and you gain the following additional features while holding it:
  • Attacks you make with the blade deal an additional 2d6 fire damage.
  • The blade emits flames that create bright light in a 5 foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.
  • You cannot be disarmed of the blade.
You can dismiss the blade at any time (no action required). If you release the blade, it immediately dismisses itself.

flaw.name: True Name
flaw.description: Your fiendish transformation is complete, and you are reborn. You receive a talisman of brimstone and brass with your true name inscribed in a fiendish language on it. A creature within 10 feet of you that knows your true name, can use an action and speak your true name in an attempt to bind you to their will. If they do, you must make a DC 20 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, you become charmed by the creature, and must complete all commands they issue to you to the best of your ability. You remain charmed for 8 hours. If the creature that bound you dies, this effect ends.

boons.name: Brimstone Pyrolysis
boons.description:
When you inflict fire damage against a hostile creature and reduce it to 0 hit points, you can immolate that creature and turn them into a Brimstone Statue.

A Brimstone Statue is the scorched remains of a corpse whose essence has burned out. A Brimstone Statue is the same size as the creature before it died, and it has an AC of 10 and 10 hit points. A Brimstone Statue that is reduced to 0 hit points falls apart and is destroyed.

As an action, you can detonate one or more Brimstone Statues that you have created. When a Brimstone Statue detonates, it is destroyed, and each creature other than you within 10 feet of the statue must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 3d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

boons.name: Commanding Obedience
boons.description: Whenever a hostile creature you can see within 30 feet of you fails a saving throw due to a spell of 1st level or higher that you cast, you can use your reaction to command that creature to kneel. On the creature's turn, it must face you, then fall prone and end its turn. If the creature is immune to the prone condition, the creature ends its turn without taking an action.

boons.name: Infernal Summoning
boons.description:
On your turn as an action, you can tear open a portal to the lower planes and summon up to 4 Imps. These Imps are each summoned into their own unoccupied space within 30 feet of you.

The summoned Imps are friendly to you and your companions. They all act directly after you in the initiative order. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions. The Imps disappear in a shower of ash and embers after 1 hour, or if they are reduced to 0 hit points.

Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

boons.name: Loophole
boons.description:
As an expert in the magic of binding and the formation of magical contracts, you gain insight into the workings of summoning spells and how to interfere with them. Whenever you encounter a summoned creature, you are immediately aware it was summoned.

As an action, you may wrest control of a summoning spell away from the caster. The spellcaster must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you gain control over the spell and any remaining creatures as if you had cast the spell, including concentration for any remaining duration.

You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1), and you regain all uses of this ability when you finish a long rest.

flaw.name: Pull of Hell
flaw.description: Your new native plane attempts to pull you to it, laying claim to your form. Whenever you roll a natural 1 on a saving throw against a magical spell or ability, you take force damage equal to your level, in addition to any other damage or effects you would suffer, as your native plane attempts to unbind you from the Material Plane.

name: Hag
description: Becoming a hag usually requires that the character is the direct, though often unknowing, offspring of another hag. The spawn of a hag may display personality quirks like a predilection for playing with the dead or torturing animals, but otherwise appears completely normal until their transformation.

prereq.roleplay: You must have been unknowingly born a hag, or you must have struck a dark bargain with a hag while exchanging something of dear sentimental value for the ritual to begin your transformation.

milestones: Consume the flesh of 313 infants
Join a hag coven and strike a bargain with an elder hag for power
Perform the ritual to create a gasdra, raise it, and complete the ritual to transform it into a giant gasdra
Trick 13 mortals into voluntarily accepting curses
Craft a hag's eye from one of your own eyes

boons.name: Crone Form
boons.description:
Your Strength score increases by 2 and your Charisma score increases by 1. An ability score cannot be increased beyond 16 this way. You also become an unseelie Fey in addition to any other creature types you are.

When you gain this ability, you must also choose an affinity with one type of hag, likely the same type as your hag mother or patron. Choose one of the following:

traits.name: Crone's Claws
traits.description: Your fingernails grow hard and sharp giving you two claws that function as natural melee weapons that use your Strength ability modifier. These claws do 1d6 damage.

traits.name: Permafrost
traits.description: You learn the Frostbite cantrip.  Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.  In addition, you are considered acclimated to cold environments and you can move across difficult terrain composed of ice or snow without expending additional movement.

traits.name: Witchcraft
traits.description: Particularly skilled in hag magic, you learn two cantrips of your choice from the Occult spell list.  Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

traits.name: Sly Corruption
traits.description: You learn how to sway others to your will and know the Charm Person spell. You can cast this spell once with this boon and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

traits.name: Sea Witch
traits.description: You become amphibious and can breathe both air and water. You also gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

boons.name: Night's Daughter
boons.description: You start to adopt your hag visage, manifesting faint wrinkles, age spots, thinning hair, and pointed ears. You gain darkvision out to 60 feet if you do not already have it and you can speak, read, and write Sylvan.

flaw.name: Planar Binding
flaw.description:
Your body and soul are bound to one of the faerie realms. You have disadvantage on death saving throws as the plane attempts to pull you back to it. If you would be killed, your soul is dragged back to a plane of existence of the GM's choice.

If you are in the faerie realm responsible for your transformation, this flaw has no effect.

boons.name: Hag Magic
boons.description:
The innate magic of your hag blood begins to manifest, and you gain the ability to cast a small number of spells, requiring no material components.

You know the Dancing Lights, Minor Illusion, and Vicious Mockery cantrips. You can also cast the Fog Cloud and Misty Step spells once each and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these innate cantrips and spells.

boons.name: Horrific Appearance
boons.description: At the beginning of your turn, you may force each creature of your choice within 60 feet of you that is aware of you to make a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened by you until the start of your next turn. Once a creature succeeds on this saving throw it becomes immune to your Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.

boons.name: Illusory Appearance
boons.description: As a bonus action, you can cover yourself and anything you wear or carry with a magical illusion that makes you look like an ugly humanoid of your general size and shape. The effect ends if you take a bonus action to end it or if you die. The illusion does not hold up to physical inspection and touching you reveals the illusion immediately. A close visual inspection sees through the illusion if the creature succeeds on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your transformation save DC.

flaw.name: Hideous Appearance
flaw.description: Your appearance has grotesquely transformed. Non-evil creatures that witness your true form become instantly hostile to you unless the GM decides otherwise. Your appearance has become like that of your hag affinity:

traits.name: Your body ripples with musclature, you grow to an unnatural height, and your bones jut out in various places.  Your fingernails and teeth become magical iron.  Your skin becomes blue or black and leathery.

traits.description: Your body becomes incredibly gaunt, blue-white skin stretched thin over little to no musculature.  Your hair turns white as snow and your eyes turn pale, the skin around them mottled blue-black as if horribly bruised.
You wither or bloat as your body struggles to deal with the ravages of age. Your hair becomes white and several feet in length. Your skin becomes green and covered in warts and boils.
Your eyes turn entirely red, and your pupils are narrow like a cat's. Your skin becomes a deep purple.
You have slimy scales and the pallid skin of a dead fish that sags from your emaciated body. Your hair resembles seaweed, and your eyes are glassy.

boons.name: Drain Vigor
boons.description:
Whenever you deal psychic damage to a creature, the target must succeed a Charisma saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the psychic damage taken. You also regain hit points equal to that amount, gaining any excess as temporary hit points that last 24 hours.

This reduction to a creature's hit point maximum lasts until the target finishes a long rest. This ability cannot reduce a creature's hit point maximum to 0, reducing it to 1 instead if it would do so.

boons.name: Invisible Passage
boons.description: As a bonus action, you can magically turn invisible until you attack, cast a spell, or until your concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). While invisible, you leave no physical evidence of your passage. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

boons.name: Mimicry
boons.description:
You gain mastery over your voice allowing you to cast Speak With Animals at will. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

You can also mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Wisdom (Insight) check against your transformation save DC.

boons.name: Grandmother's Curse
boons.description: You learn the Bestow Curse spell. You always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. You can cast the spell once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

flaw.name: Purity's Pain
flaw.description:
Unspoiled, pure things cause you physical pain to witness. The hug of a child, a loyal dog laying in its head upon a sick man's lap, a work of religious art devoted to a seraph, a baby's laughter; these things make you physically ill.

When you are in the presence of a pure act or object (GM's discretion) you are wracked with pain and while you can see the cause of your pain, you take 1d6 psychic damage at the start of each of your turns and cannot use any of your transformation boons.

boons.name: Coven
boons.description:
When you combine your magic with others, you grow in power. Over the course of a long rest, you may designate a willing spellcaster with whom you spent the long rest as a part of your coven. You can have a maximum of thirteen spellcasters in your coven, including yourself, and if you attempt to add another spellcaster you must remove an existing spellcaster.

For each spellcaster in your coven, you know one cantrip and you can prepare two spells from the Occult spell list of 5th-level or lower. You have three coven spell slots that you can use to cast these spells, all of which are 5th-level. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

subFeatures.name: Cantrips
subFeatures.description: You know a number of cantrips from the Occult spell list equal to the number of spellcasters in your coven.

subFeatures.name: Spells of 5th-Level or Lower
subFeatures.description: You can prepare a number of spells from the Occult spell list equal to twice the number of spellcasters in your coven.  All of these spells must be of 5th-level or lower.

boons.name: Death Glare
boons.description: Your visage is so horrific that it may kill a mortal. You can choose for a creature that fails its saving throw against your Horrific Appearance to drop to 0 hit points. Constructs, undead, and creatures with legendary actions are immune to this effect. Once you have used this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

boons.name: Resilient
boons.description: You are hard to kill. You gain resistance to cold and necrotic damage. In addition, when you make a saving throw against a spell you can use a reaction to gain advantage on the roll.

flaw.name: Feast of Innocence
flaw.description:
The evil in your soul burdens so heavily that you cannot stand pure souls and this drives you to feast upon the innocent. If you go more than 24 hours without consuming a good aligned humanoid, you are greatly weakened and crazed with hunger.
  • You cannot think clearly enough to cast spells.
  • You are weakened with hunger and have disadvantage on attack rolls.
  • If you hear, see, or smell purity, you must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw or go into a frenzy. While in a frenzy, you must spend each of your turns attacking the source of the purity until it is destroyed or you succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw made at the end of each of your turns.

name: Lich
description: Across the Multiverse there are many ways to become a Lich, each determining the type of Lich the mortal becomes. However, the most common method of ascending to Lichdom is The Ritual of Dread. The process of this ritual is a well-guarded secret, entrusted to only a handful of mortals at any one time. The process of the ritual involves several despicable acts including murder, the brewing of a vile concoction, and even one's own death. However, it is the process of tearing one's soul from the body that is most despised, for this process involves the sacrifice of something truly dear to a mortal, and no substitute will be accepted. For some, it is the death of a cherished loved one. For others it is a family legacy. Regardless of the sacrifice, unless the Dreadscape spirits deem it worthy, Lichdom will not be granted.

prereq.mechanical: You must have the ability to cast 7th-level spells or gain help from a sufficiently powerful magical being.
prereq.roleplay: You must complete the Ritual of Dread. The process of this ritual is partially described, but left intentionally vague so it can be tailored to your setting and campaign. Discuss with your GM how you can achieve this in-game.

milestones: Discover ancient and dark arcane knowledge
Consume the soul of an exceptionally powerful spellcaster
Build a monument to your power to serve as a giant arcane focus
Create an army of undead
Kill a god

boons.name: Harvester of Souls
boons.description:
You have gained the ability to tear the soul out of creatures you kill and consume it for its invigorating effects. Whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points, if you are on the same plane of existence as your phylactery, its soul is captured and your phylactery gains a number of soul charges equal to the creature's CR. The souls of creatures of CR 1/2 or lower are not powerful enough to charge your phylactery.

As an action, you can consume any number of soul charges from your phylactery to regain an expended spell slot of a level equal to one third of the soul charges you consume, rounded down.

boons.name: Undead Form
boons.description: Your Intelligence score increases by 4 and your Wisdom score increases by 2. An ability score cannot be increased beyond 22 this way. You become an Undead in addition to any other creature types you are. If a spell or ability other than your own would cause you to gain hit points, you gain that many temporary hit points instead. If you are reduced to 0 hit points and fall unconscious as a result, any healing you receive will stabilize you and leave you on 1 hit point and unconscious. You stop aging. You are immune to any effect that would age you, and you cannot die from old age. You do not require air, food, drink or sleep.

flaw.name: Phylactery
flaw.description:
You have successfully torn your soul from your body and trapped it in a suitable object. The object must be a trinket or item no larger than 1 square foot in size. This item becomes your phylactery.

A phylactery is an enchanted vessel containing a Lich's soul. Additionally, a phylactery is a conduit for the Lich to feed on captured souls. A phylactery is an object with an AC of 18 and 90 hit points. It has immunity to nonmagical damage, and is resistant to all other damage.

The phylactery can be charged with souls. Your phylactery can hold up to 27 soul charges.

If your phylactery is reduced to 0 hit points, your soul is lost; you crumble to dust and are killed outright. If you are killed and you control a phylactery on the same plane of existence with at least one soul charge, you consume one soul charge and your body is reconstructed within 5 feet of your phylactery 7 days later. If you are killed and your phylactery does not have any soul charges, you are reanimated 7 days later as a Demilich under the GM's control, unless you are an Archlich, in which case you die and pass on as normal.

boons.name: Lichdom of the Arcane
boons.description:
Whenever you kill any creature with a spell, you may apply one of the following additional effects depending on the damage type dealt.

This ability cannot be used when you kill a construct, undead, or any other creature without a soul.

subFeatures.name: Fire Damage
subFeatures.description: The target is vaporised into a cloud of ash and smoke. The space that the creature died in and each space within 5 feet of it are considered heavily obscured for 1 minute. Winds of moderate or greater speeds (at least 10 miles per hour) also disperse the cloud.

subFeatures.name: Necrotic Damage
subFeatures.description: As the soul of your target leaves their body, you are able to siphon off part of their life force. You regain hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) plus your level.

subFeatures.name: Posion Damage
subFeatures.description: A creature within 10 feet of the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute.

boons.name: Phylactery Bond
boons.description:
You share an especially strong bond with your phylactery and gain benefits from keeping it on your person.

You may choose to craft your phylactery into an amulet, a ring, a brooch, or some other form of jewelry. When you finish a short or long rest and you are wearing your phylactery, you may choose a damage type other than radiant damage. As long as you wear your phylactery, you have immunity to that damage type. In addition, your phylactery is more resilient than normal. Your phylactery's AC becomes 20 and its hit points increase to 120.

Your phylactery's nature is hidden from casual observation, and an observer must make an Intelligence (Arcana) check against your Transformation Save DC in order to identify your phylactery for what it is.

boons.name: Puppet Master
boons.description: Undead creatures of CR 1 or less that you animate with spells or abilities become permanently under your control. In addition, other creatures cannot gain control of undead creatures you raised.

boons.name: Rift into the Shadows
boons.description:
You gain the ability to open a rift to the Shadowfell. As an action on your turn, you can choose a point within 5 feet of you to open the rift. Once opened, the rift stretches out from that point to a 20-foot-radius sphere.

When a creature other than you enters the rift's area for the first time on its turn, or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 10d10 necrotic damage, or half as much on a successful save. Undead are immune to this feature.

The rift remains open for 1 minute, or until you are knocked unconscious. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

flaw.name: Hideous Appearance
flaw.description:
Your appearance has grotesquely transformed. Your skin has become rotten and pale, while your figure has become gaunt and hunched, radiating a ghastly aura. You can suppress this form and present the appearance of the humanoid you once were, however this is taxing and requires concentration. Moments of stress are likely to reveal your true nature. In the following situations your true form is revealed:
  • Concentrating on a spell.
  • Being knocked unconscious.
  • Entering hallowed ground.
  • Choosing to reveal yourself.
In events of extreme emotional or physical stress, a GM may call for a Constitution saving throw with a DC of their choosing to see if you maintain your humanoid form.

Non-evil creatures (or evil creatures if you are an Archlich) that witness your true form become instantly hostile to you, unless the GM decides otherwise.

boons.name: Arcane Supremacy
boons.description: You become an exemplar of arcane power. When you cast a spell that requires concentration, if you are already concentrating on one concentration spell, you do not lose concentration of that spell; instead you gain one level of exhaustion. If you are already concentrating on more than one spell, this feature has no effect. If you cast a third concentration spell during this time, you lose concentration on one of the two spells. Once you use this feature you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

boons.name: Relentless Undead
boons.description: Whenever an undead creature you control is reduced to 0 hit points, it may immediately move up to its full speed and make one attack before dying. This feature has no effect if the creature has been reduced to 0 hit points by radiant damage or a critical hit.

boons.name: Enhanced Phylactery
boons.description:
Your bond with your phylactery strengthens, granting additional benefits:
  • If you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is equal to 15 + your Dexterity modifier.
  • Your phylactery's AC is increased to 22.
  • Your spell save DC, spell attack bonus, and transformation save dc each increase by 2.
  • You and your phylactery have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

boons.name: Staff of the Shadows
boons.description:
You can use an action to summon a deathly staff made of blackened bone, twisted Gulthias wood, or another material wrought with energies of the Shadowfell. The staff is a quarterstaff, and you gain the following features while holding it:
  • Necrotic damage dealt by you ignores resistance to necrotic damage.
  • Your spell save DC, spell attack bonus, and transformation save dc each increase by 2.
  • Food and non-creature plants the staff touches wither and decay.
You can dismiss the staff at any time (no action required). If you release the staff, it immediately dismisses itself.

flaw.name: Necromantic Dystrophy
flaw.description:
Your body has become dependent on consuming souls, otherwise it becomes withered and frail. If you go more than 24 hours without converting at least four soul charges from your Phylactery into spell slots, you gain the following effects:
  • You cannot take the Dash, Disengage, or Dodge action.
  • You cannot use your reaction to make opportunity attacks.
  • You reveal your true form.
Upon converting the required amount of souls into spell slots, you are no longer affected by the aforementioned effects.

boons.name: Arcane Omniscience
boons.description: You have mastered the arcane arts. You know every spell from the Arcane and Occult spell lists and can prepare a number of these equal to your Intelligence modifier. Spells prepared this way do not count towards the maximum number of spells you can prepare. Upon completing a short rest, you can change one or more of these prepared spells for another spell from either spell list.

boons.name: Deathly Being
boons.description: You become immune to poison damage, as well as bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, you cannot become charmed, frightened, poisoned, or paralyzed.

boons.name: Lord of Undeath
boons.description: Whenever you reduce a humanoid to 0 hit points, you can choose to reanimate it. If you do, the creature rises at the beginning of its next turn as a zombie permanently under your control, following verbal commands to the best of its ability.

boons.name: Arcane Ascendancy
boons.description: Once per long rest, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can choose to cast it without expending a spell slot.

boons.name: Soul Reflection
boons.description: You have learned to utilize your bond with your phylactery to its greatest effect. While wearing your phylactery, whenever you are targeted by a spell, if you are the only target, you can use your reaction to expend soul charges from your phylactery equal to the spell's level. If you do so, the spell reflects and instead targets an appropriate target of your choice within range of the spell as if you cast it. For the purpose of using this feature, cantrips are considered 1st-level spells.

flaw.name: Weight of Undeath
flaw.description:
The weight of time is degrading for your Lich form and only the consumption of many souls can stay its effects. If you go more than 24 hours without converting at least eight soul charges from your Phylactery into spell slots you gain the following effects:
  • You cannot take the Attack action.
  • If you move on your turn, you cannot take a bonus action or reaction until the start of your next turn.
  • If you use a bonus action on your turn, your speed becomes 0 until the start of your next turn.
Upon converting the required amount of souls into spell slots, you are no longer affected by the aforementioned effects.

name: Lycanthrope
description: There are two documented methods of contracting the Lycanthropic curse. The first is being bitten by a Lycanthrope and not curing the curse before it takes hold. The second is to complete a druidic ritual known as the Lunar Sacrament. Once you have become a Lycanthrope, consider how your character feels about the curse. Do they wish to cure it before it progresses too far? Do they wish to understand it and make peace with the beast that resides within?

prereq.roleplay: You must have contracted the Curse of Lycanthropy. This usually comes from being bitten by a Lycanthrope and surviving the encounter. Alternatively, you may have completed the Lunar Sacrament and been imbued with Lycanthropy. Discuss with your GM how you can achieve this within your backstory or in-game.

milestones: Establishing a pack of other Lycanthropes
Killing an Alpha Lycanthrope
Gaining control of your animalistic urges
Unleashing the beast within and losing your humanity

boons.name: Shapechanger's Form
boons.description:
Your Strength score increases by 2 and your Constitution score increases by 1. An ability score cannot be increased beyond 16 this way.

You become a Shapechanger in addition to any other creature types you are. In addition, choose the type of lycanthrope you are from the following options:

boons.name: Hybrid Transformation
boons.description:
As a bonus action, you may transform into a monstrous hybrid: half-beast, half-sentient. While in your hybrid form, the following rules apply:
  • You can't cast spells or concentrate on spells. Your ability to speak is reduced to short, basic, guttural responses.
  • Your stats remain the same as your humanoid stats.
  • Any armor you are wearing merges into your Hybrid Form or immediately drops to the ground. The GM may decide if they feel the armour is too large to merge.
  • While transformed and not wearing any armour or using a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier.
  • While transformed you can use weapons and equipment as normal, unless specified elsewhere.
  • Your claws are natural weapons you can use to make unarmed strikes. They deal 1d6 slashing damage on a hit, and you can use your Strength or Dexterity modifier for attack and damage rolls with them. Additionally, when you take the Attack action, you can use your bonus action to make an additional attack with your claws.
  • Your bite is a natural weapon you can use to make unarmed strikes. It deals 1d10 piercing damage on a hit.
Your hybrid form lasts for a number of hours equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1) and ends early if you are knocked unconscious or reduced to 0 hit points, or until you use a bonus action to end it.

flaw.name: Lust for the Hunt
flaw.description:
The savage nature of your curse sometimes causes you to lose control. These ferocious tendencies are a constant struggle between you as a humanoid and the beast within. When you are in your hybrid form, you must succeed at a DC 10 Charisma saving throw at the beginning of each turn or lose control. If you are in the light of a full moon, you automatically fail this saving throw. If you fail this saving throw, you are subjected to the following effects until you succeed:
  • You must move toward the closest creature you can see, smell or hear, prioritising helpless creatures. If you end your movement and no creature is within 5 feet of you, then you must use your action to dash toward one.
  • If there is a creature within 5 feet of you and you have not used your action, you must take the Attack action using your natural weapons, prioritising helpless creatures.
  • If you attack a creature, and that creature is still alive, then you must use your bonus action to make an unarmed strike against the same creature.
Additionally, if you are subjected to the light of a full moon you must succeed at a DC 20 Charisma saving throw or automatically turn into your hybrid form and cannot transform back until dawn. If you succeed in this saving throw, you are immune to its effects for 24 hours.

boons.name: Heart of the Wild
boons.description: The spirits of nature speak to you through your bestial side, offering you guidance and knowledge. You may now cast and concentrate on spells in hybrid form. Additionally, you can speak, read, and write Druidic, and you have advantage on Wisdom and Charisma checks to interact with fey and beasts.

boons.name: Hunter's Howl
boons.description:
While in your hybrid form, you can use a bonus action to let out a loud howl and mark a creature within 60 feet as your prey. A creature remains marked this way for 1 hour, or until it dies. While a creature is marked as your prey, you gain the following benefits:
  • Whenever you hit the marked creature with a melee attack, you deal an additional 1d6 damage. This damage is the same type as the attack.
  • You have advantage on any Wisdom (Perception) or Wisdom (Survival) check you make to track your prey.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all expended uses of this feature upon a short or long rest.

boons.name: Ironpelt
boons.description: While in hybrid form, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-silvered, non-magical sources.

boons.name: Kindred Form
boons.description:
You gain the ability to transform into the animal form representative of your Lycanthropy type, known as your Kindred Form. You follow the same rules as the Hybrid Transformation feature and any feature that specifies the hybrid transformation, unless specified otherwise. You can only transform into the kindred form representative of your Lycanthropy. Each Kindred Form gains the following rules:
  • You cannot speak.
  • You cannot take any actions requiring hands, except your Transformation capabilities.
  • You can only use unarmed claw and bite attacks.
  • You automatically succeed at all saving throws relating to the Lust for the Hunt flaw.
Other than being larger, you are indistinguishable from a regular animal of your Kindred Form.

traits.description:
Your kindred form takes the shape of a giant badger. While in your kindred form, you gain the following additional features:
  • You can speak to and understand other badgers and mustelids.
  • You do not suffer disadvantage on attacks from being restrained or prone, and you can use your reaction to attack a creature that attempts to grapple or restrain you if they are within your reach.
  • When you drop to 0 hit points, you can choose to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a success, you drop to 1 hit point. You make this save at advantage if at least one hostile creature is adjacent to you.

Your kindred form takes the shape of a giant bat. While in your kindred form, you gain the following additional features:
  • You can speak to and understand other bats.
  • You can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action, and you have 60 feet of blindsight as long as you aren't deafened.
  • You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

Your kindred form takes the shape of a large bear. While in your kindred form, you gain the additional features:
  • You can speak to and understand other bears
  • When you make any saving throw, you can add your Constitution modifier to the result
  • Your hit point maximum increases by 15 hit points

Your kindred form takes the shape of a savage boar. While in your kindred form, you gain the following additional features:
  • You can speak to and understand other boars.
  • If you move at least 15 towards a creature and hit them with a melee attack on the same turn, you deal an additional 2d6 damage.
  • You ignore the effects of all levels of exhaustion.

Your kindred form takes the shape of a primal crocodile. While in your kindred form, you gain the following additional features:
  • You can speak to and understand other crocodilians.
  • You can add your Constitution modifier to ability checks made to grapple or to escape a grapple.
  • You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed and can hold your breath for up to 15 minutes.

Your kindred form takes the shape of a lithe jaguar. While in your kindred form, you gain the additional benefits:
  • You can speak to and understand other jaguars.
  • When you make any ability check using your Wisdom, you can add your Constitution modifier to the result
  • You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed

Your kindred form takes the shape of a giant otter. While in your kindred form, you gain the additional benefits:
  • You can speak to and understand other otters.
