  • When you make any ability check using your Dexterity, you can add your Constitution modifier to the result
  • You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed and can hold your breath for up to 15 minutes.

Your kindred form takes the shape of a giant owl. While in your kindred form, you gain the additional benefits:
  • You can speak to and understand other owls.
  • You can add your Constitution modifier to ability checks made to hide or move silently.
  • You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed

Your kindred form takes the shape of a giant rat. While in your kindred form, you gain the additional benefits:
  • You can speak to and understand other rats
  • When you make any ability check using your Dexterity, you can add your Constitution modifier to the result
  • You gain darkvision out to 120 feet. If you already had darkvision from another source, its range increases to 120 feet.

Your kindred form takes the shape of a giant raven. While in your kindred form, you gain the additional features:
  • You can speak to and understand other ravens
  • When you make any ability check using your Intelligence, you can add your Constitution modifier to the result
  • You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed

Your kindred form takes the shape of a giant snake. While in your kindred form, you gain the additional features:
  • You can speak to and understand other snakes
  • You can add your Constitution modifier to ability checks made to grapple or to escape a grapple.
  • When you are grappling a creature, they take bludgeoning damage equal to your Constitution modifier at the start of each of their turns, and they cannot speak or cast spells that require a verbal component.

Your kindred form takes the shape of a furious shark. While in your kindred form, you gain the additional benefits:
  • You can speak to and understand other sharks
  • You have advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.
  • You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed and can breathe underwater.

Your kindred form takes the shape of a lithe tiger. While in your kindred form, you gain the additional benefits:
  • You can speak to and understand other tigers
  • When you make any ability check using your Wisdom, you can add your Constitution modifier to the result
  • You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed

Your kindred form takes the shape of a giant vulture. While in your kindred form, you gain the additional benefits:
  • You can speak to and understand other vultures.
  • You have advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that has any harmful condition.
  • You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed

Your kindred form takes the shape of a ferocious dire wolf. While in your kindred form, you gain the additional features:
  • You can speak to and understand other wolves
  • When making an attack against a creature, if an ally is within 5 feet of that creature and not incapacitated, you have advantage on that attack roll
  • Your speed increases by 20 feet

Your kindred form takes the shape of a bulky yeti or large ape. While in your kindred form, you gain the additional features:
  • You can speak to and understand other apes
  • When you make any ability check using your Strength, you can add your Constitution modifier to the result
  • If you move at least 15 towards a creature and hit them with a melee attack on the same turn, you can also knock them prone.

flaw.name: Silver Sensitivity
flaw.description: You have developed a debilitating sensitivity to silver. You have vulnerability to damage dealt by silvered weapons.

boons.name: Call the Pack
boons.description:
When you use your Hunter's Howl ability, up to three creatures you designate within 60 feet of the target also gain the benefits. Your Hunter's Howl also grants those creatures advantage on attack rolls against the target if another affected ally is within 5 feet of the creature and not incapacitated.

Additionally, when a creature affected by your Hunter's Howl dies, you regain hit points equal to twice your Constitution modifier.

boons.name: Predatory Leap
boons.description: Your jump distance is doubled.  In addition, while you are in hybrid form, if you jump at least 5 feet towards a creature before hitting it with a melee attack, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.  If the target is already prone, it is instead grappled.

boons.name: Titanic Vigor
boons.description:
Your hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to twice your level, and it increases by 2 every time you gain a level.

Additionally, when in your hybrid form, you gain 5 temporary hit points at the start of each of your turns.

boons.name: Bestial Savagery
boons.description:
You have embraced the animalistic side of your transformation. While in your Hybrid Form, you gain the following benefits:
  • Your natural weapons are considered magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical damage.
  • The damage of your claws increases to 1d8 and the damage of your bite increases to 1d12.
  • Your AC increases by 1.
  • You are immune to being charmed or frightened.

flaw.name: Fraying Memories
flaw.description: You have begun to suffer the effects of sharing a mind with two personalities. Memories of less practical significance have been lost to new ones of midnight hunts. You have disadvantage on Intelligence ability checks made to recall information.

boons.name: Blood Frenzy
boons.description: The damage of your bite increases to 2d8. If you hit a creature with a bite attack, you can force the creature to make a Strength saving throw or be grappled. While the target is grappled in this way, you have advantage on attack rolls against them and deal additional damage with your natural weapons equal to your proficiency bonus.

boons.name: Savage Instincts
boons.description: You have developed an unrelenting thirst for bloodshed and carnage. While in your hybrid form, if you hit a creature with an attack, and it is missing any of its hit points, the attack deals an extra 1d8 damage.

boons.name: Unstoppable Rage
boons.description: You have become a visage of unkillable carnage and slaughter even other Lycanthropes fear. When you are reduced to 0 hit points and you are not killed outright, you are not knocked unconscious. You can take your future turns as though you were not at 0 hit points and are affected by all spells, abilities and features as normal. While you have 0 hit points, taking damage causes death saving throw failures as normal, and three death saving throw failures can still kill you.

boons.name: Kindred Affinity
boons.description:
You have reached true harmony with your Kindred Form, achieving a state of peace most Lycanthropes never find. You gain the following benefits while in your Kindred Form:
  • You can speak
  • You can cast spells without needing to provide their verbal or somatic components
  • Additionally, you can cast spells without needing to provide material components, provided they do not have a gold cost
  • Friendly creatures within 20 feet of you have advantage on Wisdom ability checks and saving throws

flaw.name: Predatory Nature
flaw.description:
You have begun to realise the true cost of your transformation. The beast within has gained more control of your body than you have. While you can control it at times you know it cannot be contained forever, and when it breaks free, it will delight in any slaughter it can find. You gain the following features:
  • If you can see, hear or smell a helpless creature, you gain disadvantage on all Wisdom saving throws.
  • At the beginning of each of your turns, if you can see, hear or smell a hostile or helpless creature, you must succeed a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw or be transformed into your Hybrid Form. If you succeed this saving throw, you become immune to this effect until the next dawn.
  • Whenever you kill a creature in your Hybrid Form, you cannot transform back into your humanoid form until the next dawn.

name: Primordial
description: There are several ways for a mortal to consume a primordial spark, but continuing to become an elemental takes concentrated effort. A mortal might be born with an elemental spark, gifted one, or they could gain one by consuming the power of an elemental. Once acquired, one must spend a great deal of time contemplating and understanding the spark to unlock its full potential.

prereq.roleplay: Either through ritual, defeating a greater elemental being, or some other means, you must consume a Primordial Spark.

milestones: Defeat and absorb the power of a greater elemental
Claim an elemental node
Make an alliance with a being from one of the elemental planes
Use your powers to defeat an encroaching civilization
Free an imprisoned or indentured elemental creature

boons.name: Elemental Form
boons.description:
Your Constitution increases by 2 and your Wisdom score increases by 1. An ability score cannot be increased beyond 16 this way.

You become an Elemental in addition to any other creature types you are.

boons.name: Primordial Affinity
boons.description: While able to control all elements, your Primordial birth was sparked by one particular element: your Primordial Affinity. Your body is infused with malleable elemental energy. You must choose an element below and gain all the benefits of that element:

traits.name: Wind Channel
traits.description: You have resistance to lightning damage. In addition, you can channel the air currents around you to guide a ranged attack. Once on each of your turns, when you make a ranged weapon or ranged spell attack, you can make that attack with advanage. If you are in a location without air - such as underwater or in a vacuum - this feature has no effect.

traits.name: Stone's Brawn
traits.description: You have resistance to acid damage. In addition, whenever you gain temporary hit points, you gain additional temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

traits.name: Raging Flame
traits.description: You have resistance to fire damage. In addition, whenever you deal fire damage, you can add your Constitution modifier to the damage dealt.

traits.name: Healing Waves
traits.description: You have resistance to cold damage. In addition, whenever a creature regains hit points due to your spell or feature, you can imbue them with healing elemental energy. The creature regains additional hit points equal to your proficiency bonus. Only one creature who regains hit points from the spell or feature can benefit from this.

flaw.name: Planar Binding
flaw.description:
Your body and soul are bound to a primordial plane of existence. You have disadvantage on death saving throws as the plane attempts to pull you back to it. If you would be killed, your soul is dragged back to a plane of existence of the GM's choice.

If you are on the primordial plane responsible for your transformation, this flaw has no effect.

boons.name: Dual Nature
boons.description: You can choose to add a second elemental source from the Primordial Affinity Boon to add to your form. When you do so, you gain the associated benefits of your new element.

traits.name: Wind Channel
traits.description: You have resistance to lightning damage. In addition, you can channel the air currents around you to guide a ranged attack. Once on each of your turns, when you make a ranged weapon or ranged spell attack, you can make that attack with advanage. If you are in a location without an air current - such as underwater - this feature has no effect.

traits.name: Stone's Brawn
traits.description: You have resistance to acid damage. In addition, whenever you gain temporary hit points, you gain that many plus your proficiency bonus instead.

traits.name: Raging Flame
traits.description: You have resistance to fire damage. In addition, whenever you deal fire damage, you can add your Constitution modifier to the damage dealt.

traits.name: Healing Waves
traits.description: You have resistance to cold damage. In addition, whenever a creature regains hit points due to a spell or feature you control, you can imbue them with healing elemental energy. The creature regains additional 1d6 hit points. Only one creature who regains hit points from the spell or feature can benefit from this.

boons.name: Elemental Surge
boons.description: You can channel pure elemental energy into a concentrated bolt of an element of your choice. On your turn, as an action you can choose one of the below choices for which you have an element.  You can use these features a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier, regaining all expended uses upon completing a long rest.

traits.name: Lightning Strike
traits.description:
You can make a special ranged attack targeting a creature within 60 feet. You are proficient with this attack, which uses your Constitution modifier. On a hit, this attack deals lightning damage equal to 3d8 + your Constitution modifier. When you use this feature, you can then use a bonus action to target another creature with 30 feet of the first target with the same attack.

For each additional level you gain in this transformation, the damage increases by 1d8.

traits.name: Earth Shard
traits.description:
You can force a creature within 30 feet to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes bludgeoning damage equal to 3d6 + your Constitution modifier, or half as much on a successful save.

For each additional level you gain in this transformation, the damage increases by 1d6.

traits.name: Flame Wave
traits.description:
Each creature in a 15-foot cone originating in your square must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, creatures in the area take fire damage equal to 2d8 + your Constitution modifier.

For each additional level you gain in this transformation, the damage increases by 1d6.

traits.name: Aquatic Rejuvenation
traits.description:
Choose a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The creature regains a number of hit points equal to 2d8 + your Constitution modifier.

For each additional level you gain in this transformation, the number of hit points restored increases by 1d6.

boons.name: Call the Four
boons.description:
You can use your action to summon or repel elemental forces around you, causing one of the following effects of your choice for which you have the element(s):
  • Air:
  • Earth:
  • Fire:
  • Water:

subFeatures.name: Air
subFeatures.description: You create a 15-foot radius globe of breathable air around you. Creatures can pass freely in or out of the globe, but elemental forces cannot. Alternatively, you can choose to banish all air from inside the globe. This globe lasts for 10 minutes, and you must concentrate on it (as if concentrating on a spell).

subFeatures.name: Earth
subFeatures.description: You conjure up to 50 pounds of loose earth at a point within 30 feet of you. Alternatively, you can shape the earth and stone within 15 feet of you. If affecting dirt or stone on the ground, you can cause it to become difficult terrain.

subFeatures.name: Fire
subFeatures.description: All flammable objects not worn or carried within 30 feet of you to burst into flames. Alternatively, all nonmagical flames within 30 feet of you are extinguished.

subFeatures.name: Water
subFeatures.description: You conjure up to 10 gallons of water at a point within 30 feet of you or cause the water to fall like rain in a 30-foot-radius for 1 minute. Alternatively, you can choose to repel water within 15 feet of you. This ability repels mist, rain, and other similar forms of water, and creates pockets of air if submerged in water.

flaw.name: Elemental Appearance
flaw.description:
Your appearance has grotesquely transformed. Your eyes might be smoldering embers, water could continuously pour from your mouth or nose, your extremities may crumble like sand, or patches of your skin might fade to transparency. You can suppress this form and present the appearance of the humanoid you once were, however this is taxing and requires concentration. Moments of stress are likely to reveal your true nature. In the following situations your true form is revealed:
  • Concentrating on a spell.
  • Being knocked unconscious.
  • Entering hallowed ground.
  • Choosing to reveal yourself.
In events of extreme emotional or physical stress, a GM may call for a Constitution saving throw with a DC of their choosing to see if you maintain your humanoid form.

boons.name: Aura of Awakening
boons.description: You emit an aura of power that awakens the elemental forces in your companions. When you first gain this feature, choose one of the options below for which you have the element. You may change the aura you emit upon completing a long rest.

traits.name: Light as Air
traits.description: Whenever you or a friendly creature within 10 feet of you makes a Dexterity saving throw, the creature gains a bonus equal to your Constitution modifier. You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

traits.name: Heart of Stone
traits.description: At the beginning of each of your turns, you and each creature of your choice within 10 feet of you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier. While a creature has temporary hit points gained in this manner and are not incapacitated, they cannot be forcefully moved or knocked prone. You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

traits.name: Forged in Fire
traits.description: Whenever you or a friendly creature within 10 feet of you deals damage with a melee weapon attack, they deal additional fire damage equal to your Constitution modifier. You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

traits.name: Spring of Life
traits.description: Each unconscious creature of your choice within 10 feet of you regains 1 hit point at the beginning of their turn. You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

boons.name: Master of Many
boons.description: You can choose to add a third elemental source to your form. When you do so, you gain the associated benefits of your new element from Primordial Affinity in addition to your current source benefits.

traits.name: Wind Channel
traits.description: You have resistance to lightning damage. In addition, you can channel the air currents around you to guide a ranged attack. Once on each of your turns, when you make a ranged weapon or ranged spell attack, you can make that attack with advanage. If you are in a location without an air current - such as underwater - this feature has no effect.

traits.name: Stone's Brawn
traits.description: You have resistance to acid damage. In addition, whenever you gain temporary hit points, you gain that many plus your proficiency bonus instead.

traits.name: Raging Flame
traits.description: You have resistance to fire damage. In addition, whenever you deal fire damage, you can add your Constitution modifier to the damage dealt.

traits.name: Healing Waves
traits.description: You have resistance to cold damage. In addition, whenever a creature regains hit points due to a spell or feature you control, you can imbue them with healing elemental energy. The creature regains additional 1d6 hit points. Only one creature who regains hit points from the spell or feature can benefit from this.

boons.name: Primeval Body
boons.description: Your transformation to an elemental form has changed your body entirely. You no longer need to sleep, breathe, or eat. You also gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.

flaw.name: Force of Nature
flaw.description: You are losing your connection to societal norms. The needs of civilization, community, and morals pale in comparison to the elemental chaos roiling within you. Whenever you complete a long rest, if you are within civilization, you do not regain any hit dice or lose any levels of exhaustion. In these circumstances, the GM decides if a location is considered civilized or not. Alternatively, the GM can decide that a park or grove within a city is sufficient.

boons.name: Elemental Mastery
boons.description:
You gain the fourth elemental source to your form. When you do so, you gain the associated benefits of your new element from Primordial Affinity.

Additionally, you can summon the four elements to wreath you in power. Whenever a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to force it to make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 damage of a type of your choice from bludgeoning, cold, fire, or lightning, or half as much on a successful save. Until the end of your following turn, your Primordial Affinity feature has one of the following additions for which you have the element. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier, regaining all uses upon completing a long rest.

traits.name: Wind Channel
traits.description: You have resistance to lightning damage. In addition, you can channel the air currents around you to guide a ranged attack. Once on each of your turns, when you make a ranged weapon or ranged spell attack, you can make that attack with advanage. If you are in a location without an air current - such as underwater - this feature has no effect.

traits.name: Stone's Brawn
traits.description: You have resistance to acid damage. In addition, whenever you gain temporary hit points, you gain that many plus your proficiency bonus instead.

traits.name: Raging Flame
traits.description: You have resistance to fire damage. In addition, whenever you deal fire damage, you can add your Constitution modifier to the damage dealt.

traits.name: Healing Waves
traits.description: You have resistance to cold damage. In addition, whenever a creature regains hit points due to a spell or feature you control, you can imbue them with healing elemental energy. The creature regains additional 1d6 hit points. Only one creature who regains hit points from the spell or feature can benefit from this.

subFeatures.name: Air
subFeatures.description: You have advantage on all ranged weapon and ranged spell attacks.

subFeatures.name: Earth
subFeatures.description: At the beginning of each of your turns, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your level.

subFeatures.name: Fire
subFeatures.description: At the beginning of each of your turns, each creature of your choice within 5 feet of you takes 2d6 fire damage.

subFeatures.name: Water
subFeatures.description: Whenever a creature regains hit points due to your spell or feature, that creature regains an additional number of hit points equal to your level.

boons.name: Energy Flow
boons.description: As a bonus action, you can burst into a shower of elemental material then materialize somewhere else. You magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see, along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying. After teleporting, you can choose one of the following for which you have the element.  You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier. You regain all expended uses at the end of a long rest.

subFeatures.name: Swift Assault (Air)
subFeatures.description: You can immediately make a weapon attack. If you make a ranged attack, you do not have disadvantage if a hostile creature is within 5 feet.

subFeatures.name: Boulderous Hide (Earth)
subFeatures.description: Choose a damage type. Until the start of your next turn, you have resistance to that damage type.

subFeatures.name: Spark Storm (Fire)
subFeatures.description: Each creature within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save creatures take 2d6 fire damage.

subFeatures.name: Sea Mother's Tether (Water)
subFeatures.description: A thin tether of water links you to a creature within 30 feet for 1 minute. While tethered, if the creature would take damage, you can choose to take that damage instead. Additionally, if you would be damaged, the tethered creature can choose to take that damage instead. This damage cannot be reduced or prevented in any way.

boons.name: Potent Aura
boons.description: Creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you gain resistance to acid, cold, fire, and lightning damage.

flaw.name: Pull of Chaos
flaw.description: Your new native plane attempts to pull you to it, laying claim to your form. Whenever you roll a natural 1 on a saving throw against a magical spell or ability, you take force damage equal to your level, in addition to any other damage or effects you would suffer, as your native plane attempts to unbind you from the Material Plane.

name: Revenant
description: Revenants are created when a creature dies with unfinished business in the mortal world. Though even still, not all creatures possess the capacity to become a revenant. Such a transformation requires incredible willpower. Mostly, a revenant serves their own aims until they are completed, upon which time they die. However, occasionally, a creature can become a more tragic type of revenant, where a powerful necromancer or otherworldly entity revives them as a servant. Regardless of how you have become a revenant, you should discuss with your GM what type of revenant you would like to become, and how it can be implemented in the campaign.

prereq.roleplay: You must have died, with a powerful force of either your own willpower or a powerful being's magic pulling you back to the world of the living. Discuss with your GM how you can achieve this in-game.

milestones: Die in battle in the process of completing your goal
Complete an aspect of your goal, without completing the entire goal

boons.name: Undead Form
boons.description: Your Constitution score increases by 2 and your Wisdom score increases by 1. An ability score cannot be increased beyond 16 this way. In addition, your creature type changes to undead. If you are reduced to 0 hit points and fall unconscious as a result, any healing you receive will stabilize you and leave you on 1 hit point and unconscious. Furthermore, you cannot die from old age and you do not require air, food or drink.

boons.name: Relentless Nature
boons.description:
You and your DM decide upon a goal for you - typically one related to your character's death. The goal must be a specific task you can complete, such as slaying an enemy or liberating an area and its people. Until you fulfill that goal, you gain the following benefits:
  • If you are below half your hit point maximum at the start of your turn, you regain 1 hit point.
  • If you die, you return to life at full hit points 24 hours after death. If your body is destroyed, you reform within 1 mile of the place of your death at a spot determined by the DM. If your equipment was also destroyed, you do not regain it.
When your goal is complete, you finally find rest. You die and cannot be restored to life by any means.

flaw.name: Crumbling Lifeforce
flaw.description: Your grasp on the world is tenuous at best, and your soul longs to leave this world and travel to the world of the dead. You are not affected by restoration magic of any kind, and do not regain hit points when you finish a short or long rest.

boons.name: Horrifying Visage
boons.description: At the beginning of your turn, you may force each creature of your choice within 60 feet of you that is aware of you to make a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened by you until the start of your next turn. Once a creature succeeds on this saving throw it becomes immune to your Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours.

boons.name: Relentless
boons.description: You no longer require sleep, and can fill a long rest with light activity such as keeping watch. In addition, you do not gain a level of exhaustion from lack of rest.

boons.name: Vengeful Tracker
boons.description: You know the distance and direction between you and any creature involved in your goal, even across planar borders, such as a person you seek vengeance against or someone you pledged to defend.

flaw.name: Hideous Appearance
flaw.description:
Your appearance has greatly altered from its original features. Your skin is pale and clammy, your eyes have a haunting appearance with a violent flare of determination constantly present, and you appear as if a corpse of yourself. However, the following situations can reveal your true appearance:
  • Concentrating on a spell.
  • Being knocked unconscious.
  • Entering hallowed ground.
  • Choosing to reveal yourself.
In events of extreme emotional or physical stress, a GM may call for a Constitution saving throw with a DC of their choosing to see if you maintain your humanoid form.

boons.name: Life Drain
boons.description: Your touch disrupts the life force of other beings. As an action, you can choose a creature within 5 feet to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 8d8 necrotic damage, and you gain half as many temporary hit points. If this damage causes the creature to drop to 0 hit points, the creature dies and you regain an expended use of this boon. You can use this boon a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all uses when you finish a long rest.

boons.name: Unfaltering
boons.description: If you spend 8 hours outside of combat, you gain the benefits of a long rest, regardless of your other actions. If you enter combat at any point, you must spend 8 hours after the end of the combat in order to gain the benefits of a long rest.

flaw.name: Untethered Mind
flaw.description: Your mind starts to follow your body in its dissolution. Less significant memories of your existence before your revenant transformation, other than those related to your goal, start to fade like they're dreams you've awakened from. The GM can claim you can't recall something from your living past when it's dramatic or might disadvantage you. Also, you have disadvantage whenever you attempt an Intelligence check to recall information not related to your goal. This lack of connection to your previous self can cause personality changes. You might forget old grudges or traumas, which can change your personality traits or alignment for the better. It's more likely that you cling to any vestige of your old self, amplifying their importance, nursing resentments and gloomy thoughts. You might come to hate those who have a normal existence, taking a turn toward evil.

boons.name: Regenerate
boons.description: You regain 10 hit points at the start of your turn if you have at least 1 hit point remaining. If you take fire or radiant damage, this feature does not function at the start of your next turn.

boons.name: Vengeful Glare
boons.description:
Once per long rest, you can attempt to enact your vengeance on a target related to your goal. You can use an action to force a creature that can see you within 60 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw.

On a failed saving throw, the target is paralyzed until you deal damage to it, or until the end of your next turn. When the paralysis ends, the target is also frightened of you for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if it can see you, ending the frightened condition on itself on a success.

flaw.name: Hyperfocused
flaw.description: You only care to complete your goal, and have no time for anything else. You have disadvantage on any ability check, attack roll, or saving throw you make that does not directly benefit you in your pursuit of your goal.

name: Seraph
description: To be chosen by an Arch Seraph is to become a vessel for the principles they uphold. This is a charge not to be taken lightly, and those who display righteousness with the intention of becoming a Seraph are usually overlooked for this reason. When becoming a Seraph, consider why your character was chosen. Do you display hidden merit? Are you devoted to a cause they will value?

prereq.roleplay: You must have been exalted by an Arch Seraph, divine cosmic energies, or have some other plausible reason to have become a Seraph. Discuss with your GM how you can achieve this in-game.

milestones: Defeating a powerful force of darkness
Create a hallowed landmark for pilgrims
Establish a parish of worshipers who uphold your virtue
Establish a portal between the Material Plane and the Empyrium
Redeem a soul that was considered beyond redemption

boons.name: Angelic Wings
boons.description: You have manifested feathered wings. You have a flying speed equal to your normal speed. You cannot wear armour or clothing that has not been modified to accommodate your wings.

boons.name: Celestial Form
boons.description:
Your Wisdom score increases by 2 and your Constitution score increases by 1. An ability score cannot be increased beyond 16 this way.

You become a Celestial in addition to any other creature types you are.

flaw.name: Planar Binding
flaw.description:
Your body and soul are bound to a divine plane of existence. You have disadvantage on death saving throws as the plane attempts to pull you back to it. If you would be killed, your soul is dragged back to a plane of existence of the GM's choice.

If you are on the divine plane responsible for your transformation, this flaw has no effect.

boons.name: Divine Clemency
boons.description:
When you or a creature you can see within 60 feet takes damage, you can use your reaction to cast a spell of 1st level or higher that has a casting time of 1 action or 1 bonus action. This spell must target the damaged creature and restore hit points to it.

You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

boons.name: Divine Expedition
boons.description:
At the beginning of another creature's turn, you can use your reaction to move yourself up to your speed, or allow a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you to move up to their speed. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

boons.name: Divine Protection
boons.description:
When you or a creature you can see within 30 feet is targeted by an attack, you can use your reaction to shield them with holy light. The target gains a +4 bonus to AC against the attack.

You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

boons.name: Divine Retribution
boons.description:
When you or a creature you can see within 30 feet takes the Attack action, you can use your reaction to imbue them with holy zeal. They can make an additional attack as a bonus action. This attack deals an extra 1d8 radiant damage.

You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

flaw.name: Divine Appearance
flaw.description:
Your appearance has radically transformed. Your body radiates a divine glow, while your wings are prominent and powerful appendages. You can contain this form and present the appearance of the humanoid you once were, but this is taxing and requires concentration. Moments of stress are likely to reveal your true nature. In the following situations, your true form is revealed:
  • Concentrating on a spell.
  • Being knocked unconscious.
  • Entering hallowed ground.
  • Choosing to reveal yourself.
In events of extreme emotional or physical stress, a GM may call for a Constitution saving throw with a DC of their choosing to see if you maintain your humanoid form.

Evil humanoid creatures that witness or hear about your true form become instantly hostile to you and are compelled by malice to destroy you, unless the GM decides otherwise.

boons.name: Cleanse Affliction
boons.description: When you cast a spell that restores hit points to a creature, you can also remove one condition being inflicted on them.

boons.name: Radiant Strike
boons.description: Whenever you hit a target with a melee attack, you deal an additional 1d6 radiant damage to the target. This damage increases to 2d6 if the target is a fiend or undead.

boons.name: Holy Bulwark
boons.description:
You may use your action to steel yourself against the tactics of your most hated adversaries, gaining one of the following benefits.

This effect lasts until you use this feature again.

subFeatures.name: Cleanse the Undead
subFeatures.description: You gain resistance to necrotic damage.

subFeatures.name: Ignore Fey Trickery
subFeatures.description: You gain immunity to the charmed and frightened conditions.

subFeatures.name: Stand Against the Infernal
subFeatures.description: You gain resistance to fire damage.

boons.name: Bow of Celestial Judgement
boons.description:
You can use a bonus action to summon a powerful bow made of divine light. The bow takes the form of a bow of your choice. Attacks with the bow deal radiant damage, and you gain the following additional features while you hold it:
  • The bow does not use ammunition. Instead, when the wielder draws the bowstring, an ethereal arrow of radiant light forms.
  • The bow's damage is increased by one damage die. Against fiends and undead, the bow deals an additional two damage dice instead.
  • The bow's radiant form emits bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet
You can dismiss the bow at any time (no action required). If you release the bow, it immediately dismisses itself.

flaw.name: Beacon to Darkness
flaw.description: You have become a Seraph of noted virtue and divinity. This has made you a target for all that is dark in the world. Whenever you or an ally within 30 feet commits an act of greater evil, such as murdering a helpless innocent, a small amount of darkness attaches itself to you, and you gain 1 corruption point (to a maximum of 5). Whether the act constitutes greater evil is determined by the GM. Whenever you make an attack roll against an evil creature, or make a saving throw against a spell or ability from an evil creature, subtract the number of corruption points you have from the roll. Whenever you complete a short or long rest, and have prayed for at least 1 hour, you can reduce the number of corruption points you have by 1.

boons.name: Aura of Celestial Resilience
boons.description: You emit an aura of stalwart conviction. This aura radiates up to 20 feet from you while you are conscious. When you or a creature of your choice within range of your aura fails a saving throw, they can choose to succeed instead. Once a creature has benefited from this feature, they cannot benefit from it again until they have completed a long rest.

boons.name: Aura of Empyreal Valor
boons.description: You emit an aura of swiftness and bravery. This aura radiates up to 20 feet from you while you are conscious. You and creatures of your choice within range of your aura gain a +5 bonus to initiative rolls. In addition, on an affected creature's turn they gain advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn in combat yet.

boons.name: Aura of Holy Purge
boons.description: You emit an aura of righteous fervour. This aura radiates up to 20 feet from you while you are conscious. When you or a creature of your choice within range of your aura hits a creature with an attack, they can choose for that hit to be a critical hit. Once a creature has benefited from this feature, they cannot benefit from it again until they have completed a long rest.

boons.name: Aura of Merciful Blessing
boons.description: You emit an aura of invigoration and fortitude. This aura radiates up to 20 feet from you while you are conscious. When you or a creature of your choice within range of your aura is reduced to 0 hit points, they are reduced to 1 hit point instead. Once a creature has benefited from this feature, they cannot benefit again until they have completed a long rest.

flaw.name: Pull of the Empyrean
flaw.description: Your new native plane attempts to draw you to it, laying claim to your form. Whenever you roll a natural 1 for a saving throw against a magical spell or ability, you take force damage equal to your level, in addition to any other damage or effects you would suffer, as your native plane attempts to unbind you from the Material Plane.

name: Specter
description: Methods of becoming a specter vary, and few find their way willingly. Contact with the forces of death is the most common-a would-be hero is corrupted by the force they wanted to fight. Sinister rituals can also infuse a body with the powers of unmaking. Alongside beings and magic of death stand entities that exist in a reality untethered from the material world as mortals understand it. These others and their minions, manifestations of otherworldly chaos, can infuse a person with that chaos, making the victim's ultimate home a dream of cosmic horror.

prereq.roleplay: You must have contact with the world of the dead, either through an encounter with a monstrous and incorporeal undead creature or through contact with the afterlife. Some magical rituals can infuse mortals with this energy. Alternatively, you have had contact with an entity or force that has caused your material form to start to slip out of existence.

milestones: Defeat a powerful, ghostly undead and absorb its power. Or defeat an aberration of similar might that has powers over space, time, or death
Use a ritual that infuses your body with the forces of death or primordial chaos

Survive a near-death experience caused by a ghostly undead creature or an aberration, especially one in which your hit point maximum is reduced, such as by a wraith's life drain, or in which you drop to 0 hit points
Kill a significant foe with necrotic or psychic damage, or by using necromancy magic
Infuse other willing people with the power that corrupts you
Deal with ghosts and similar spirits, or beings of other realities, perhaps as a conduit between them and other mortals
Open a gate or path to places of the dead or the dreams of the Aether Kindred

boons.name: Spectral Movement
boons.description: Your walking speed increases by 10 feet. In addition, you can move through other creatures and solid objects as if they were difficult terrain and you can move through difficult terrain as if it were normal. If you end your turn inside a creature or object, you're shunted back to where you entered and take 1d6 force damage per 10 feet you travel in this way.

boons.name: Spectral Presence
boons.description:
Your Dexterity increases by 2 and your Charisma increases by 1. No ability score can increase above 16 in this way. If your transformation is due to contact with the afterlife, you become Undead in addition to any other creature types you are. If your transformation is due to an abnormality with reality, you become an Aberration in addition to any other creature types you are.

In addition, you cease aging and cannot be aged magically.

flaw.name: Close to Death
flaw.description: Your body and soul have a tenuous grasp on existence. You have disadvantage on death saving throws as the pull of a peaceful death calls out to you. If you would be killed, the GM chooses whether you die, or you transform into an incorporeal undead or aberration under the GM's control. If you are on the Ethereal Plane, this flaw has no effect.

boons.name: Ethereal Phasing
boons.description: You can cast the Blink spell without expending a spell slot. Once you cast the spell using this boon a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

boons.name: Horrifying Visage
boons.description: At the beginning of your turn, you may force each creature of your choice within 60 feet of you that is aware of you to make a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened by you until the start of your next turn. Once a creature succeeds on this saving throw it becomes immune to your Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours.

boons.name: Spectral Flight
boons.description: You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover.

flaw.name: Haunting Appearance
flaw.description:
Your true form is ghostly and haunting, whether due to your connection to death or your tenuous ties to material reality. Although your appearance isn't necessarily scary, your spectral form seems unnatural to normal creatures who might believe you to be a ghost or other sort of spirit. You can manifest as the humanoid you once were, but doing so requires concentration on your part.
  • Concentrating on a spell.
  • Being knocked unconscious.
  • Entering hallowed ground.
  • Choosing to reveal yourself.
In events of extreme emotional or physical stress, the GM can call for a Constitution saving throw with a DC of their choosing to see if you reveal your hideous appearance.

When you reveal your hideous appearance, how viewers react is up to the GM. They might treat you as a ghost or another monster in disguise. Hostility and fear are likely reactions in these cases.

boons.name: Haunting Jaunt
boons.description:
You can use a bonus action to choose an unoccupied space within 120 feet then you fly in a direct line from your current space to that chosen space. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks. Each creature you pass through as part of this movement must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take psychic damage equal to 3d6 + yur Dexterity modifier and be frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

Once you use this boon, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

boons.name: Life Drain
boons.description:
Your touch disrupts the life force of other beings. As an action, you can choose a creature within 5 feet to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 8d8 necrotic damage, and you gain half as many temporary hit points. If this damage causes the creature to drop to 0 hit points, the creature automatically dies and you regain an expended use of this boon.

You can use this boon a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

boons.name: Spectral Body
boons.description:
Your body fades further into the immaterial, giving you certain benefits and abilities:
  • You are immune to disease, exhaustion, and poison.
  • When you take damage other than force, you can use a reaction to gain resistance to the triggering damage and reveal your true form.
  • You no longer require air, food, water, or sleep.

flaw.name: Untethered Mind
flaw.description:
Your mind starts to follow your body in its dissolution. Less significant memories of your existence before your specter transformation start to fade like they're dreams you've awakened from. The GM can claim you can't recall something from your living past when it's dramatic or might disadvantage you. Also, you have disadvantage whenever you attempt an Intelligence check to recall information.

This lack of connection to your previous self can cause personality changes. You might forget old grudges or traumas, which can change your personality traits or alignment for the better. It's more likely that you cling to any vestige of your old self, amplifying their importance, nursing resentments and gloomy thoughts. You might come to hate those who have a normal existence, taking a turn toward evil.

boons.name: Call of Unmaking
boons.description:
As a bonus action, you reveal your true form and give a mournful wail or otherwise set up a wracking vibration. This sound has no effect on constructs and undead.

All creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. Creatures that can't hear you have advantage on the saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is cursed for the next minute. While cursed, a creature takes an additional 1d6 necrotic damage each time it takes damage. Once you use this boon, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

boons.name: Ethereal Denizen
boons.description:
You gain 60 feet of truesight.

Additionally, you can use an action to cast the Etherealness spell without expending a spell slot. Once you cast the spell using this boon, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

boons.name: Possession
boons.description:
As an action, you reveal your true form and enter the space of a humanoid or beast and force that creature to make a Charisma saving throw. If the target fails, you disappear, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. You control the body without depriving the target of awareness.

While possessing a target, you can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect. You retain your alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and any immunity to being charmed and frightened. Otherwise, you use the possessed target's statistics but don't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, and proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the possessed target drops to 0 hit points, you end it as a bonus action, or until you are forced out by an effect that ends possession. When the possession ends, you reappear in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. You can use this boon again only after you finish a short or long rest.

flaw.name: Pull of Oblivion
flaw.description: Dissolution pulls on your body and soul. Whenever you roll a natural 1 on a saving throw against an effect that deals you damage, you lose 1d6 hit points per two levels you have as the afterlife or your lack of reality pulls you toward nothingness. If you die, your body disappears, and you can be raised from the dead only with a Wish spell or True Resurrection spell. If you and the GM agree, you might instead become an NPC monster under the GM's control, such as a wraith or a bizarre space-time aberration.

name: Vampire
description: Vampires are spawned into the world when a mortal contracts the Sanguine Curse, dies, and is reborn undead. There are a variety of ways to contract the curse. A Vampire may have offered their blood to a loyal servant, powerful ally, or loved one they wished to elevate. More commonly, a Vampire may have bitten you, and you survived the Vampire's attack long enough to contract the Sanguine Curse before perishing and being reborn. Other methods include ancient and dark magic, as well as powerful but cursed magical artifacts. Regardless of how you have become a Vampire, you should discuss with your GM what type of Vampire you would like to become, and how it can be implemented in the campaign.

prereq.roleplay: You must have contracted the Sanguine Curse, whether by being bitten by a Vampire, offered their blood, completing the Sanguine Ritual, or by another plausible method. Discuss with your GM how you can achieve this in-game.

milestones: Establish a coven of vampire spawn
Drink the blood of a legendary monster
Learn the great secrets of vampirism from a Vampire Lord
Learn to embrace your Hideous Form and lose the ability to conceal it
Discover the lost crypts of an ancient vampire and consume its essence

boons.name: Blood Fury
boons.description: You have become possessed by the thirst that grips all Vampires. In combat, this thirst drives you into an insatiable frenzy of bloodshed. Whenever you deal damage with an unarmed strike or a weapon to a target that has blood, you gain one Fury Point. You may only have a maximum of 4 Fury Points at any time. Upon completing a short or long rest, the number of Fury Points you have is reset to 0. These points are used by certain abilities that you can learn through your transformation levels.

subFeatures.name: Fanged Bite (1)
subFeatures.description: On your turn, immediately after you take the Attack action, you can use your bonus action to make a special unarmed bite attack. You can use your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. This attack deals piercing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier on a hit. The target must then succeed at a Constitution saving throw or take 2d6 necrotic damage. You regain hit point equal to the necrotic damage dealt this way. This attack generates 1 Fury Point as normal. If this attack reduces a humanoid creature of your size or smaller to 0 hit points, you gain 3 Fury Points instead.

subFeatures.name: Calculated Strike (1)
subFeatures.description: When you hit with a melee weapon attack, you may add 1d6 to the damage. If this ability is used, no Fury Points are generated for this attack.

subFeatures.name: Unearthly Reflexes (1)
subFeatures.description: After you have rolled a Dexterity saving throw, but before you know the results of the roll, you can use your reaction and take half damage on a failed save, and no damage on a successful one.

subFeatures.name: Vampiric Mist (2)
subFeatures.description: As a bonus action, you can disappear in a puff of shadowy mist and teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

subFeatures.name: Deathly Horror (3)
subFeatures.description: As a bonus action, you can emit a ghastly distortion of your true form. A creature of your choice within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw is immune to this ability for 24 hours.

boons.name: Undead Form
boons.description: Your Dexterity score increases by 2 and your Charisma score increases by 1. An ability score cannot be increased beyond 16 this way. You become am Undead in addition to any other creature types you are.  If a spell or ability other than your own would cause you to gain hit points, you gain that many temporary hit points instead. If you are reduced to 0 hit points and fall unconscious as a result, any healing you receive will stabilize you and leave you on 1 hit point and unconscious. You stop aging. You are immune to any effect that would age you, and you cannot die from old age. You do not require air, food, drink or sleep, but you must drink at least one pint of blood every 7 days.

flaw.name: Sanguine Curse
flaw.description:
The sanguine curse has taken a hold on you. As a result you gain the following features:
  • You cannot enter a residence you do not own without an invitation from one of the occupants. If you enter a residence involuntarily such as by being dragged into one, you take 1d10 psychic damage at the start of your turn while you are inside it.
  • You gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet if you do not already have it.
  • While in sunlight, you have disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

boons.name: Dread Knight
boons.description:
You become trained in the martial ways of the Dread Knights. As a bonus action, you may enter or exit one of the following combat stances. While in a combat stance, you gain the features of that stance.

Additionally, all melee weapons that deal slashing damage gain the Finesse property for you.

subFeatures.name: Accurate Stance
subFeatures.description: While in this stance, you gain a bonus to hit with your weapon attacks equal to half the number of Fury Points you currently possess (minimum of 1).

subFeatures.name: Defensive Stance
subFeatures.description: While in this stance, you gain a bonus to your AC equal to half the number of Fury Points you currently possess (minimum of 1).

subFeatures.name: Offensive Stance
subFeatures.description: While in this stance, you deal an additional damage with your melee weapon attacks equal to the number of Fury Points you currently possess (minimum of 1).

boons.name: Night Stalker
boons.description:
You gain proficiency in Stealth. If you already have proficiency in Stealth, then your proficiency bonus is doubled when making Stealth ability checks.

Additionally, you can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured, including dim light.

Finally, you gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. You can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

boons.name: Sanguine Magic

prereq.value: the ability to cast at least one spell

boons.description:
Your curse corrupts the magic you cast. Whenever you deal damage with a spell, you can choose to deal necrotic damage instead of that spell's normal damage type. Furthermore, whenever you deal damage with a spell, you gain one Fury Point (maximum of 1 per turn).

Additionally, you gain the following Blood Fury abilities:

subFeatures.name: Cast in Blood (1)
subFeatures.description: The next time you cast a damage-dealing cantrip, you can add your Charisma modifier to the damage you deal.

subFeatures.name: Sanguine Spellbinding (3)
subFeatures.description: As a bonus action, you empower your spells with sinister blood magic.  The next time a creature makes a Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw against a spell you have cast, it has disadvantage. If a spell affects multiple creatures at the same time, you choose which creature is affected.

boons.name: Shapechanger
boons.description: You can use an action to polymorph into a bat, or into a cloud of mist.  Additionally, you are considered a shapechanger.

subFeatures.name: Bat Form
subFeatures.description:
While you are transformed into a bat, the following rules apply:
  • Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of a Bat, but you retain your alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You also retain all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature. If the creature has the same proficiency as you and the bonus in its stat block is higher than yours, use the creature's bonus instead of yours.
  • When you transform, you assume the beast's hit points and Hit Dice. When you revert to your normal form, you return to the number of hit points you had before you transformed. However, if you revert as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to your normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce your normal form to 0 hit points, you aren't knocked unconscious.
  • You can't cast spells, and your ability to speak or take any action that requires hands is limited to the capabilities of your beast form. Transforming doesn't break your concentration on a spell you've already cast, however, or prevent you from taking actions that are part of a spell, such as Call Lightning, that you've already cast.
  • You retain the benefit of any features from your class, race, or other source and can use them if the new form is physically capable of doing so. However, you can't use any of your special senses, such as darkvision, unless your new form also has that sense.
  • You choose whether your equipment falls to the ground in your space, merges into your new form, or is worn by it. Worn equipment functions as normal, but the DM decides whether it is practical for the new form to wear a piece of equipment, based on the creature's shape and size. Your equipment doesn't change size or shape to match the new form, and any equipment that the new form can't wear must either fall to the ground or merge with it. Equipment that merges with the form has no effect until you leave the form.

subFeatures.name: Vampiric Mist
subFeatures.description:
While you are in mist form, the following rules apply:
  • You cannot take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects.
  • You are weightless, have a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can fit through a space, then you can as well. You cannot pass through liquid, and this does not give you the ability to cross running water.
  • You have advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and are immune to all non magical damage.
  • Any object you are holding or armour you are wearing merges into your mist form or immediately drops to the ground. The GM may decide if they feel the object cannot merge.
  • If you become unconscious in mist form, you revert back to your vampiric form.

flaw.name: Hideous Appearance
flaw.description:
Your appearance has greatly altered from its original features. The first signs were the fangs that started to protrude from your upper row of teeth. You have no reflection in mirrors or other reflective surfaces. With dry, pale skin and occasional burns from the sun, you can hide your true appearance by concentrating on your pre-vampirism appearance. However, the following situations can reveal your true appearance:
  • Concentrating on a spell.
  • Being knocked unconscious.
  • Entering hallowed ground.
  • Choosing to reveal yourself.
In events of extreme emotional or physical stress, a GM may call for a Constitution saving throw with a DC of their choosing to see if you maintain your humanoid form.

boons.name: Captivating Glance
boons.description: You gain proficiency in Deception and Persuasion. If you are already proficient in one of these skills, then your proficiency bonus is doubled for checks using that skill. Additionally, your thoughts cannot be read by any means.

boons.name: Creatures of the Night
boons.description:
You can magically call to your aid 2d4 swarms of bats or 2d4 swarms of rats. When outdoors, you can summon 2d4 wolves instead of swarms of rats. These creatures arrive at the end of your next turn at a destination of the GM's choice within 30 feet of you, and they are under your control. They act directly after you in the initiative order and remain for 1 hour, until you die, or until you dismiss them with a bonus action. You cannot use this ability if you are exposed to direct sunlight.

You can use this feature once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

boons.name: Cruel Riposte
boons.description: Whenever a creature within 5 feet of you makes an attack against you, you may use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against the attacking creature. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Dexterity modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all expended uses of this feature when you complete a long rest.

boons.name: Improved Shapechanger
boons.description:
When you use your Shapechanger ability, you may also take on the form of a dire wolf. This follows the same rules of your bat form, except that you use the stats of a dire wolf.

Additionally, you gain the ability to use Fanged Bite while in animal form. The piercing damage for your Fanged Bite changes based on your form. While in bat form you deal 1 piercing damage, and while in dire wolf form you deal 2d6 piercing damage.

Finally, while in mist form you may cast the Fog Cloud spell once without expending a spell slot and without using verbal, somatic, or material components. You regain the ability to cast this spell when you finish a long rest.

flaw.name: Greater Sanguine Curse
flaw.description:
Your curse has taken a stronger hold on you. As a result you gain the following features:
  • You take 1d10 acid damage if you end your turn in running water
  • The range of your darkvision increases to 120 feet.
  • You take 1d10 radiant damage when you start your turn in sunlight.
  • You must drink at least one pint of blood every 3 days.

boons.name: Beguiler's Entrancement
boons.description:
You gain the ability to manipulate the mind of a humanoid with your sanguine magic. You can use an action to make an incapacitated humanoid charmed by you for 24 hours or until you target a different humanoid with this ability. If you use this ability on the same target for 30 unbroken days, the target becomes permanently charmed by you.

You may use this ability on another humanoid once you have permanently charmed the previous humanoid. You can have a maximum number of enthralled humanoids equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). If the number of enthralled humanoids exceeds your Charisma modifier for any reason, you lose connection to all of them. This charm effect can be removed with the Remove Curse spell or similar magic.

boons.name: Grim Executioner
boons.description: You have mastered the martial techniques of the Dread Knight. Whenever you roll a critical hit with a weapon attack, and the target has 50 or fewer hit points, you kill the target instantly. If your target has more than 50 hit points, you deal an extra 6d6 damage.

boons.name: Innate Sangromancy
boons.description: When you cast a spell, you may choose to spend Fury Points to add an additional effect of your choice.  If you do so, you do not gain Fury Points from the damage the spell deals.

subFeatures.name: Beguiling Spell (2)
subFeatures.description: If a creature fails their saving throw against this spell, they are also charmed by you until the end of your next turn.

subFeatures.name: Shadow Spell (2)
subFeatures.description: If a creature fails their saving throw against this spell, they are unable to perceive you until the end of your next turn, except by magical means.

subFeatures.name: Vampiric Spell (3)
subFeatures.description: If you cast a spell that deals necrotic damage, you heal for up to half the amount of damage dealt.

subFeatures.name: Withering Spell (3)
subFeatures.description: If you cast a spell that deals necrotic damage, it deals an additional 1d8 necrotic damage per level of the spell slot expended. Additionally, creature damaged by the spell cannot take reactions until the end of your next turn.

boons.name: Regenerate
boons.description: You regain 10 hit points at the start of your turn if you have at least 1 hit point remaining, and are not in sunlight or over running water. If you take radiant damage, this ability does not function at the start of your next turn.

flaw.name: Stake to Heart
flaw.description: Whenever you're attacked by a creature with a wooden or silvered weapon, if they score a critical hit, and you have 50 hit points or less, they manage to lodge their weapon into your heart and you become paralyzed until the weapon is removed.
